items.content:
Full-Stack Engineer Business Processes & Intelligence for a real estate app

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Information Technology, Mobile Application, Real Estate
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Allthings | Freiburg im Breisgau, Germany

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Berlin
Office Location: Freiburg im Breisgau, Germany. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

node.js
reactjs
postgresql
typescript
lambda

Job description

About your new job:

As a full-stack engineer in our Business Processes & Intelligence team you will work on all parts of the “engine” driving the business processes and business intelligence of Allthings.

This includes building interfaces with our Allthings product platform and several cloud services (e.g. CRM, project management, accounting, mailing), aggregating and enriching their data in our relational database, building custom business apps and tools, and automating all business-relevant processes around them.

You will work together with all teams and departments across the whole company and have a great impact and influence on the way your colleagues will do their daily job.

Working with the data, you will be the go-to person for analytics and business intelligence related questions, and the central enabler for data-driven decision making, from Sales to Customer Success, and from Product Engineering to Finance. You will find your stakeholders along the entire value-chain and customer journey.

What we value:

  • A hands-on attitude for quick iterations
  • Ability of rapid context switching
  • A passion for data - finding the needle in the haystack is a joy for you
  • Strong interest in understanding and shaping business operations and processes
  • Automate Allthings!

We offer:

  • A state-of-the art technology stack (AWS Lambda, Docker, NodeJS, React, TypeScript, PostgreSQL)
  • Your choice of laptop and freedom of software development environment
  • Competitive salary and industry-standard benefits
  • Flexible work time
  • A product, which 60 European real estate companies count on after 18 months of market traction
  • A product, which was named “best connected home solution 2015” at the 2015 Mobile World Congress in Barcelona
  • An experienced management team, a first-class technology and operations team as well as investors, who - together with us - aim to lead in our field globally
  • A company culture that fosters “what is right” rather than “who is right”

You have:

  • Experience in implementing and working with REST APIs
  • Experience with SQL and complex data models, ideally PostgreSQL
  • Experience in implementing web applications (front-/back-end)
  • Experience with JavaScript/TypeScript and NodeJS, knowledge of AWS/React/Redux/GraphQL/Webpack/MongoDB a plus
  • Experience with BI tools, e.g. Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, SSRS
  • A university degree or equivalent credibility
  • A good sense of humor :)

Workplace:

We are open to remote work, e.g. in Berlin, Freiburg, Frankfurt, Basel, Zürich...

Apply now

About Allthings

Allthings transforms buildings into digital products. The Allthings platform grants users of buildings access to digital services that simplify everyday life, connect people and improve communication. Property owners benefit from an unprecedented level of transparency in buildings, neighborhoods and across entire portfolios. Thanks to the open, modular design of the Allthings platform, third-party services can be integrated as needed, much like an app store for buildings. 

Originally founded in 2013 in Basel as a spin-off of ETH Zurich, the company now has offices in Basel, Berlin, Frankfurt am Main and Freiburg im Breisgau. Its 60-person team aims to achieve lasting improvements to life in buildings. As a digital pioneer in the industry, Allthings has won numerous prizes and boasts a clientele that includes some of Europe’s largest real estate companies. For more information go to www.allthings.me.

Contact

Interested? Apply now! If you have more questions, feel free to drop our Head of HR Christian Steffen a line via christian.steffen@allthings.me.

Benefits

  • Competitive salaries
  • Your choice of laptop
  • Freedom of software development environment
  • 30 days of paid vacation time
  • Annual budget for conferences and educational material
  • Flexible work time
  • Part-time home office possible

items.content:
Frontend Vue Engineer at Gun.io

Remote | Freelance | International

Frontend Vue Engineer

REMOTE

FREELANCE AND CONTRACT

CONTRACT FULL-TIME

Gun.io was borne to connect talented F/OSS developers with discerning and quality-focused software companies. Today, our ambitions are much greater. We’re creating a new framework for all knowledge work.

Why is this role amazing?

You’ll work as a Professional Freelancer (what’s that mean?) in Gun.io’s amazing community. Each Gun.ioclient has been vetted for their ability to maintain 6 month engagements and pay US market rates.

What’s the project?

General: Gun.io’s client is looking for an enthusiastic and fun front end Vue developer to work with their team to develop the frontend of their “Heroku-like” Dashboard and “Docker-like” Hub.

What you’ll be doing:

  • The primary objectives are developing the frontend of our dashboard (Heroku like dashboard) and hub (like Docker Hub).
  • Being a key member and owner in the development and design of new projects
  • Brainstorming and whiteboarding with your colleagues about architecture decisions and help work them out
  • Continuously work to improve development work in all areas (coding, tools, process, testing, etc.)
  • Be a technical, “go to” for the team/ organization to help business create efficient and effective requirements.
  • Find and help fix stability, scalability, performance issues, cross browser compatibility, Web standards and interoperability.

Geography: Open to worldwide candidates with at least 4 hours crossover time with Amsterdam, Netherlands.

Work Schedule: 30-40 hours/week.

Start & Duration: Start as soon as you’re ready. Duration of 2-3 months.

What’s the process?

In keeping with our promise to only provide elite Professional Freelancers, Gun.io’s vetting process is stringent and includes: a credential check, three interviews, and live reference checks. However, you will only need to complete that vetting process for your first Gun.io project. Afterwards, you’ll have the opportunity to seamlessly move on and off freelance projects.

Candidates who pass Gun.io’s internal vetting will be given an opportunity to directly engage and interview with Gun.io’s clients.

Gun.io works extremely hard to secure stable, long-term relationships with our clients. Every role on every team works together to secure more work together. What starts as a short project always has the opportunity to grow if we perform with excellence.

Must-have experience or requirements

  • 5 years experience in frontend development
  • Expert Vue experience in production
  • Comfortable working with an entire FOSS product and microservice architecture
  • Demonstrate development of high quality, performant, maintainable and testable applications
  • Worked closely with experienced product & design teams to build intuitive experiences in a highly-visible environment.
  • You have a sense of humor, maybe even enjoy a bit of sarcasm, and enjoy a diverse atmosphere and possess excellent team-working skills
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Nice-to-have experience

  • Experience with DevOps tools is preferred but not required.
  • Microservices

By now, you know our reputation on HackerNews, Reddit, and other spots for taking care of our community. Join up and get serious about your career.

  • “One of the best teams I’ve ever worked with.”
  • “There’s visible, constant improvement; it’s not just lip service.”
  • “You guys paid for my Jeep Wrangler.”
  • “Working with Gun.io has, for the first time, allowed me to fit work into my life instead of life into my work.”
Apply for job

Boston, Remote · Full Time

$95K–$125K
0.02%–0.08%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

We’re looking for a developer with a pixel-perfect mindset and knack for building intuitive user interfaces with compelling visualizations. In this role, you will lead UI development efforts of major features all the way from concept to deployment. This includes meeting with customers to review and refine mockups, and collaborating with backend engineers on API design.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

(*) Design & implement product features using JavaScript, LESS, Handlebars, Vue.js, and third-party libraries

(*) Bring data to life with insightful, actionable visualizations

(*) Collaborate with the team and customers on feature requirements and prioritization

(*) Ensure the continued stability, performance, and quality of the Hospital IQ codebase, and security of customer data

(*) Vet, integrate, and enhance third-party scripting libraries such as D3, Highcharts, Lodash, and Selectize

QUALIFICATIONS:

(*) 4+ years designing and developing complex web applications using JavaScript + jQuery + CSS/Less/Sass

(*) Object-oriented JavaScript programming skills

(*) RESTful API design skills

(*) Exposure or interest in build/package tools (gulp/yarn/npm) a plus

Note: A full stack role is also available for candidates with interest in our Python + Django + MySQL server-side stack on Google Cloud Platform.

Job Description

THE COMPANY
We are a young, lean, seed funded AngelPad company looking for a kick ass AngularJS font end developer to join our team and help build our product Process Street.

We are well funded, growing quickly and will be at break even soon.

We have 100+ Fortune 1000 companies using our product including teams at:
Walmart
BP
Shell
IKEA
Uber
Accenture
Deloitte
Ernest and Young
Johnson and Johnson
And the list goes on...
Plus thousands of small businesses in 1500+ cities around the world.

THE PRODUCT
Process Street is the first truly bottom up process and workflow management platform positioned to take down old behemoths like MS Sharepoint.

Process Street is built API first and the front end is built completely in AngularJS which talks to the backend through the API.

Signup to get a feel for the Angular Front-End.

This is what you will be working on.

THE OPPORTUNITY
You will get to hone your AngularJS skills by working on an app that gets used by thousands of people a day. You will be working with a smart, senior team with tons of experience to guide you and help you develop your angular skills.
We work with a modern lean stack and you will see tangible results of your work going live on a weekly basis and being used by thousands of people.

WHO ARE YOU?
- Self taught programmer from a young age
- Hungry developer who some may or may not call a workaholic
- Looking to really build out your resume by gaining experience on a complex and exciting product and tech stack
- Looking to learn from experienced developers and startup founders
- A crazy hard worker and self starter (read HUNGRY)
- An expert at self learning on the web and a relentlessness to continue hacking at a problem all night until its solved, just for the rush of figuring it out for yourself

You should also have:
- 1+ years Javascript experience
- A degree in CS or equivalent
- Your own project on GitHub

Remote Full Stack Developer Scala/JavaScript for Seed-Funded AngelPad Co (Mid-Snr) at Process Street

Vancouver, Toronto, Waterloo, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Java, Javascript, HTML, CSS, PostgreSQL, Scala, Amazon Web Services, API, Play Framework, AngularJS
Compensation
$70K–$150K
0.1%–1.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

This is going to be a minimalist job description.

Apologies for the lack of fluff.

Opportunity:

We are a young, lean, recently funded startup building a highly scalable consumerized B2B SaaS product.

You can learn more about our product here: https://www.process.st.

Right now, we are all about building a super high-quality product from the inside-out. We're obsessed with user experience and care deeply about our customers. We are looking for someone who takes pride in their work.

Join on the ground floor.

This will be a full-stack development role working where you will be responsible for owning major features in the product.

You will be working in a team with 2 senior Scala/Full-stack engineers with 30 years combined experience, so you will not be fending for yourself, but you will still have plenty of freedom and flexibility to own your features.

Our app is built API-First on Play Scala, AngularJS and PostgreSQL. We are hosted on AWS using Elastic Beanstalk, RDS, etc.

Requirements:

1. You are a full-stack beast. You program in multiple languages, you can wear multiple hats, you thrive in a fast-paced and unstructured environment, you program for fun- you know, startups.

2. You are ok with a "go all in" startup lifestyle. We can pay a solid salary and offer great equity but don't expect to be heading to work in a fancy office with a gourmet kitchen (at least not for the next year or so).

If this seems interesting to you drop me a line and let's discuss further.

Full Stack developer at Fulfil.IO

Bengaluru, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Python, Android, iOS Development, Ecommerce, Front-End Development, Git, PostgreSQL, Full Stack Development, Angular.JS, Remote Team Management
Compensation
₹400K–₹600K
0.1%–1.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Available

Job Description

We're an early stage product startup – and looking for passionate full stack developers. The job is a full-time position based out of Bangalore, but remote work is an option.

Our Tech Stack :

* Servers & Microservices: Python, Javascript
* Infrastructure: Amazon AWS, Docker
* Database: Amazon RDS, DynamoDB, Redshift
* Frontend: Angular JS, Angular Material
* Mobile: Ionic

What we expect in you:

* Familiarity with Python and ORMs (SQLAchemy, Django and cousins)
* Understanding of Relational Databases (We love postgres)
* Experience with at least one Python web framework (Flask is cool).
* Ability to visualize a request-response cycle whether it happens from a desktop app, browser, mobile app or over a web socket.
* 0 – 2 years of software development experience (professional, freelance or hobbyist). Github profiles matter.
* Self motivated. Sorry no managers here.
* Excellent communication skills. We slack a lot!
* Understanding of tests and appreciates Test Driven Development (TDD).

What you will do:

* Develop across the stack.
* Integration of user-facing elements developed by front-end developers with server side logic.
* Integration with other systems (shipping, warehouses) over API.

Rarely required:

* Ability to work flexible hours when necessary for deadlines and off-hours installations
* Occasional availability for on-call/emergency support.

Some of the benefits:

* Solve a real world problem - inventory management and shipping products on time is hard. (No offense to our friends making yet another way to post a picture online).
* Work with an international team
* Remote work
* Small team with opportunity to have great impact
* Equity as an option

items.content:
Front End Developer (Marketing) at ConsenSys

Brooklyn, San Francisco, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Javascript, HTML, CSS, Wireframing
Compensation
$90K–$120K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

ConsenSys is a venture production studio focused on building and scaling tools and enterprise software products on the Ethereum platform. Our mission is to use these solutions to power the emerging economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet.

Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, security and infrastructure, and more. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.

The Role

ConsenSys is seeking an experienced front-end developer to oversee development of a wide variety of consumer-facing Consensys projects. The ideal candidate is first and foremost passionate about user experience, but also excited to help set-up a front-end tech stack that can be used across the wider Consensys ecosystem.

Prior experience with startups and working with agile, cross-functional teams is a plus. In-depth knowledge about Ethereum is not required, but candidates should generally be interested in the technologies poised to transform the way we live and be open to learning deeply about blockchain topics.

Responsibilities

- Using HTML/CSS/Javascript to turn wireframes and visual designs into compelling production user experiences
- Strong working knowledge developing cross platform/browser compatibility
- Familiarity with web standards and best practices for fast load times and accessibility
- General knowledge of SEO and marketing analytics best practices
Writing clean, standards-compliant, scalable, reusable, quality code

Requirements

- 3+ years in a front-end engineering role building user interfaces for dynamic web applications
- Expert knowledge of HTML, CSS, and Javascript frameworks
- Great interpersonal skills and a willingness to go above and beyond when collaborating with designers, marketers and other engineers
- Comfortable prototyping ideas and iterating them based on user feedback
- Passion for writing tests to ensure delivering high-quality user experiences
- Strong visual and aesthetic sense – a portfolio of past projects is a plus
- Bonus points for contributing to open source projects or having some of your own

Job Description

We're an early stage product startup – and looking for creative and thoughtful UX Developer to become a part of our team. If building enterprise software that makes a dent in the world is interesting, continue reading:

Why do we need a UX Jedi in our team:

1. Enterprise softwares usually have bad UX. Don't believe us ? Overlook the screens at checkout counters.
2. We believe that great UX is the key to making good software.

What we look for in you:

* Being able to distinguish good, bad and the ugly when it comes to UX.
* Experience of building intuitive user experience focused user interface for Desktop and Mobile.
* Good grasp of typography, colors, and user interface layouts.
* Awareness of Google’s material design specs and Apple’s human interface guidelines. (Check it out if you don't know)
* By now we certainly hope you know what responsive design is.

Bonus if you have the following:

* Knowledge of UI frameworks like bootstrap, foundation, angular material.
* Familiarity with tools like Sketch, Invision (or related toolkit)

Job Description

We're looking for experienced full stack developers that love crafting beautiful web apps and smart applications. If you're at this stage of your career where you're looking for a position where you can contribute directly to product development and really make a difference in the business (and be rewarded for it) we should talk!

***MUST HAVES***

Your background:
- You have a Bsc/MsC in computer Science, mathematics or any other degree or experience that demonstrates highly analytical skills
- You've got a successful experience working for a startup
- You've helped your team build a great B2B/SaaS (rather complex) product and can demonstrate your direct contribution in achieving this

Your skills:
- 3+ years experience working with our technology stack (e.g. html5/CSS3, Angular JS, React JS, Node JS)
- You can demonstrate ability to quickly understand customer/business problems and you're pretty creative at finding solutions to solve them.
- You own your features from A to Z and can ship the features expected with clean code, quickly.
- You have a strong UX/UI focus but can dive into backend when required (Node JS and postgreSQL required)
- You're comfortable with customer facing interactions

Personality traits we’ll be looking for:
- You've got tons of curiosity
- You learn insanely fast and adapt to change easily
- You've demonstrated grit, tenacity to achieve challenging goals (personal and/or at work)
- High EQ: you communicate well and can get along with all our team members (rather they're in product or growth parts of the business)
- You have strong work ethic and are autonomous

***NICE TO HAVES***
- You speak another foreign language (e.g. French, German, Spanish, Italian)
- Experience with finance/accounting, fleet/asset management software

***SALARY/COMPENSATION***
We believe a small team of rock stars can accomplish at least 10x more than an average team so we recruit very selectively and for the right candidate our salary/compensation package can be pretty competitive. We also offer flexible/remote working conditions however team get-togethers are required from time to time, especially during your onboarding (expect somewhere fun in South Europe, but that's a surprise!), so you need to be opened to travel.

Job Description

ConsenSys is a venture production studio and the leading technology firm in blockchain globally. We deliver products, solutions and platforms built using blockchain technology to transform how business is done in complex network of buyers, suppliers and consumers.

Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, the music industry, security, and infrastructure, and more. To accomplish this we've built out a flat organizational structure which we call the ConsenSys Mesh: a network of individuals & teams working autonomously and towards the same goal. Our mission is to use these decentralized solutions to fundamentally reshape the economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.

About Meridio at ConsenSys:

Meridio is a platform to create, manage, and trade fractional ownership shares in real estate assets. Our mission is to democratize real estate investment allowing anyone, anywhere the right to own and invest in this fundamental shared resource of our planet. To find out more about the project, please visit the following link: https://www.meridio.co/

Writing excellent code

Willingness to learn new tools
Continually evaluate and improve the platform and dev workflow as it scales

4+ years engineering experience with a proven history of shipping code
Experience with React and Javascript
Personal interest in real estate, blockchain, or both

Job Description

InboundLabs is hiring an extremely talented front end developer.

InboundLabs.co is an international agency-hybrid, with a remote team that works together seamlessly. We are a HubSpot diamond partner and specialize in the tech field, especially with startups. You are an experienced developer with outstanding communication skills.

>>Objective:
You will work with our team on clients' projects on HubSpot.

>>Core Responsibilities:
* Work directly with our team and sometimes clients and implement websites meticulously
* Deliver clean and organized code
* Coordinate with the team on various projects
* Move things forward by responding to messages and proactively following up

>>You are:
* You are a reliable, punctual, responsible, mature professional that has discipline and requires no supervision
* You need to be able to read English manuals, news and material. You also have to be able to understand your team member English chat messages and express yourself proficiently in chat messages and tasks. You also need to be able to capture audio instruction in English: training videos, webinars and video calls. Can’t actually speak English but you're an amazing developer? Let us know.
* You are the opposite of an asshole
* You genuinely care about your customers and about the team
* You’re a team player for real, you learn from critical feedback and you strive to be better at everything you do
* You take responsibility for shit. Made a mistake? Shit happens. Own it. Fix it.
* You are a curious person, you always want to learn new things
* You have the ability to operate in a sometimes chaotic and always fast-paced environment
* You want to improve processes and strive when you’re given freedom to do so
* You are always on top of things. Nothing slips through the cracks (and when it does, you own that shit)
* You have real experience in working remotely for at least a year (as a freelancer, not with a fixed salary)
* You love testing out new online tools and apps

Senior JavaScript Engineer at Knack

United States, Remote, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Javascript, SQL, Big Data, MongoDB, Node.js, MariaDB, Vue.Js
Compensation
$90K–$125K
0.5%–2.5%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

More about Knack and this position:

https://knack.com/about
https://www.knack.com/work-at-knack

Knack is hiring a senior javascript engineer! You’ll be an integral part of our engineering team focused on building and scaling a world-class product.

We do things a little differently here at Knack, and that’s just how we like it:

* Flat: we don’t have project managers or dictates from a CTO. Each engineer is lead on multiple projects and is expected to make major decisions.
* Autonomous: our engineers own their projects, collectively determine technical implementation, and have the freedom to define how they can maximize their impact.
* Engaged: our engineers think of their job as more than just 1s and 0s. Only by engaging with our product, our customers, and our team can they be fully equipped to do their best work.
* Remote: to make this work our engineers are great communicators and are highly involved with hangouts/chat/discussions around both engineering topics and larger company issues.

This isn’t for everyone, but for the right fit this will be the definitive experience of your career. Our goal will be to ensure you are driven and supported to continuously grow and do your best work.

This is a senior position, so we’re looking for a strong track record of shipping code and building products at scale. With that said, we’re not looking for a 100% match on experience or our stack. If you have a history of shipping solid work, we’re interested.

About the Job

Our senior engineers are ultimately responsible for delivering an outstanding product. This includes:
* Implementing and architecting new features.
* Optimizing our systems for performance, including speed, reliability, redundancy, and geographic distribution.
* Fixing bugs and issues.
* Working with our success team to address customer issues and concerns.
* Building tools and processes to improve our operations and help us detect and respond to issues.

How you’ll do this:

* Program: ship code every day
* Contribute: we want our engineers to make an impact on the Knack product. This means you're not just implementing features that have been specified to death. It includes developing ideas, making suggestions, and keeping on top of new tech to understand opportunities.
* Engage: we have enough areas of need where we want to leverage what you're excited about and use that to make Knack a better product.
* Learn and grow: we do code-reviews, pair-programming, lunch-and-learns, and actively engage in chat to constantly teach and learn.

You won’t have a direct boss but will be working collaboratively with our current engineering team of 10, and with cross-functional teams on specific projects.

Our work is 100% remote. We use Slack, Trello, Google Docs and Google Hangouts to get our work done.

*Our stack*

AWS - we’ve drunk the kool-aid and use AWS across the board.
Node.js - APIs
MongoDB, Redis, MariaDB - data persistence
Vue.js, Backbone - our front-end is largely raw JavaScript/jQuery/Backbone, currently migrating to Vue.js.
Github, Jenkins, Webpack - deployment
Ghost Inspector, Sentry, LogRocket - testing

*About You*

Above all, you build things. You have a history of starting --and completing-- projects, whether that’s products, applications, games, libraries, or plugins.

You’re both a teacher and a learner. You’re not afraid to admit when someone may know more than you. You have the confidence to help others level up.

You want to work on a product you can be proud of that impacts thousands of people all over the world, from non-profits to the world’s biggest companies.

You go all in. You want to do your best work, and have that work make an impact.

*About Knack*

Knack is a no-code platform that makes it easy for anyone to build applications and workflows to do amazing things with their data.

Knack launched in 2012 and has been growing steadily as we’ve built our team, perfected our product, and nailed our product-market fit. We’re now ready to take things to the next level and maximize the opportunity for what this product can be.

*Benefits & Compensation*

Competitive salaries and generous equity: rather than give up equity to investors to pay engineering salaries, we’ve chosen to give more of that equity to our team while still paying strong salaries.

Define your work: our only rule is our overlap zone of 11am to 4pm EST. Otherwise find the location, environment, and schedule that is best for your life and work.

Unlimited Paid Vacation: take the time you need to stay motivated, charged, and balanced.

Paid Corporate Retreats: we get together twice a year at amazing locations to do normal human being things in person. We pay for your flight, lodging, and meals.

Learning Credits: an annual allowance is provided to stay on top of your game with classes, books, and conferences.

HealthCare: we offer health, vision, and dental, covering 75% of the premium for you and your dependents (spouse + children).

Job Description

Scal.io is a leading software development studio headquartered in downtown San Francisco with remote offices in Orange County and Atlanta. We've designed and developed systems, services and applications used daily by millions of people. From iOS and Android, to web-scale architectures in Javascript and Python, our engineers have worked across all technologies and stacks. We’ve developed software for a broad range of industries in entertainment, e-commerce, education, news, health, financial, media, real estate and government for companies such as Google, Uber, Yahoo, 23andMe, Brit+Co and Digg. We’ve partnered with numerous international organizations, think tanks, and NGOs to develop innovative technology for global markets.

We are currently seeking talented front-end/UI experts to join our professional, internationally distributed engineering team. This is a full time remote position.

Required Skills and Experience:

-- 5+ years of JavaScript experience with heavy emphasis on SPA architecture
-- 2+ years experience with Angular 2-5 and TypeScript
-- Strong HTML/CSS skills, preferably with emphasis on SASS/LESS
-- Experience implementing SPAs from top to bottom starting just design/requirements
-- Experience writing Unit/Behavior tests for Angular applications (Protractor, Jasmine+Karma, etc)
-- Working knowledge of the modern JS toolchain - gulp, bower, npm, webpack, etc
-- Strong working knowledge of Git (Git Flow, pull requests, etc)
-- Ability to read and understand English software requirements, strong written English, ability to conduct a basic interview in English
-- Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, etc or equivalent experience

Nice To Have Skills and Experience:

-- Full-Stack experience including Restful APIs and databases (sql, nosql)
-- AngularJS 1.x experience
-- Exposure to redux/ngrx store
-- Experience with RxJavaScript
-- Experience with other JS compatible transpiled languages (Scala JS, Kotlin JS, etc)
-- AWS cloud expertise
-- Continuous Integration experience with CircleCI or similar
-- Backend experience with NodeJS + Hapi or Scala + Finagle
-- Recent native mobile expertise, iOS or Android
-- Strong Verbal English Skills

Job Perks:

-- Work with a variety of clients including Fortune 500 and leading tech companies
-- Top of Market Pay for the right candidate (in USD)
-- Full-time remote position
-- Flexible working hours
-- Very professional team

Along with your cv, please, send us the links to the relevant code samples (Angular1, Angular2+, etc) and/or links to recent projects.

We also love likes on our Facebook page if you feel inclined. :)

https://www.facebook.com/ScalioLabs/

We kindly ask agencies not to bother applying.

* Learn and grow: we do code-reviews, pair-programming, lunch-and-learns, and actively engage in chat to constantly teach and learn.

You won’t have a direct boss but will be working collaboratively with our small engineering team of 10, and with cross-functional teams on specific projects.

Our work is 100% remote. We use Slack, Trello, Google Docs and Google Hangouts to get our work done.

*About You*
Above all, you build things. You have a history of starting --and completing-- projects, whether that’s products, applications, games, libraries, or plugins.

You’re both a teacher and a learner. You’re not afraid to admit when someone may know more than you. You have the confidence to help others level up.

You want to work on a product you can be proud of that impacts thousands of people all over the world, from non-profits to the world’s biggest companies.

You go all in. You want to do your best work, and have that work make an impact.

*About Knack*
Knack is a no-code platform that makes it easy for anyone to build applications and workflows to do amazing things with their data.

Knack launched in 2012 and has been growing steadily as we’ve built our team, perfected our product, and nailed our product-market fit. We’re now ready to take things to the next level and maximize the opportunity for what this product can be.

So why are we different?

We’re bootstrapped: we’ve had to build something our customers actually pay for. This changes how you do things.

We’re 100% remote: and have been from the beginning. Every decision we’ve made has been based around optimizing our remote operations.

We’re small: and we like it that way. We’re more than just chat avatars-- we’ve all gotten to know each other, have grown together, and love working with each other.

We enjoy the journey: we’re in this for the long haul. We’re not chasing an exit or the next round of funding. We’re building something we’re proud of and want to keep improving on.

items.content:
Remote Front-End Developer

Full-time
Anywhere
Remote job
Small business
Posted Today – Accepting applications

Who is Fracture?

Fracture is re-inventing the way consumers print and display their digital images. Our first product, printed glass “Fractures”, allow you to print your images directly onto glass and have them shipped right to you in our custom designed packaging. Check it out at Fracture.Me. We’ve sold over 650,000 fractures to almost 200,000+ customers in 50+ countries, but this is just the beginning. We’re just scratching the surface of our potential. Our uniqueness stems from the fact that we actually design, engineer, and manufacture something tangible, 100% in-house. Real. That’s what we love about what we do. We’re blending cutting edge e-commerce with lean manufacturing to make your digital images become real.

Who are we looking for?

The Front End Developer joining our team will be responsible for maintaining our current E-Commerce platform, built on CodeIgniter. These responsibilities will include bug fixes, implementation of new features, new content and updates to existing content as well as upgrading and securing legacy software and APIs.

 

As Fracture migrates to a new E-Commerce platform in 2019, this developer will participate in the planning and development of that website. They will work with our E-Commerce director to create a data translation layer or API which will facilitate communication between our E-Commerce website and our on-site production application and database. This developer will also be a key component of the team as we build out new features, products, and services for our customers.

 

The right person will have excellent communication skills and a strong track record of working in fast-paced, agile environments. They will also take pride in the quality of code that is deployed and that no detail is too fine to be overlooked. The best candidates will have a history of working in E-Commerce where they understand the necessity of A/B testing, strategic planning, and world-class execution in order to provide a superior user and customer experience that accurately reflects our brand.

 

Required Skills

  • Minimum of 6 years development experience
  • Must have experience building and maintaining web applications with PHP MVC frameworks CodeIgniter or Laravel
  • Expert level knowledge of WordPress including theming, plugin development, the WordPress REST API and Customize API
  • Must have familiarity with the implementation and customization of WooCommerce and WooCommerce API
  • Experience working on a high traffic E-Commerce website (1M+ unique/mo)
  • The ability to optimize applications for speed and scalability
  • Must be able to work with Sketch files (Mac-based)
  • Knowledge working with responsive CSS frameworks, preferably Bulma
  • Should understand the importance of excellent documentation and have strong organizational skills

Must be proficient with:

  • PHP
  • MySQL and PostGres
  • HTML5
  • Flexbox and CSS grid
  • CSS Preprocessors, specifically SASS
  • Javascript (ES6) and jQuery
  • Build tools like Gulp, Grunt and/or Webpack
  • CSS methodologies such as BEM, OOCSS or SMACSS
  • GIT

Preferred Skills

  • Experience implementing and strategizing deployment when using testing tools like VWO or Optimizely
  • Background implementing an ERP connection (Sage, SAP) with E-Commerce platforms
  • Background in writing APIs or data translation layers
  • Experience with Node, NPM and React a bonus

Working conditions

 

Remote applicants will be considered for this position. EThe employee will be required to work regular business hours (Eastern time zone) and be on-call as needed nights and weekends.

 

What’s in it for you?

 

We’re offering a competitive salary, equity, and health care benefits – to name the tangibles. As far as the intangibles, we are committed to a safe, positive and enthusiastic culture. We believe our team is the core of everything and we put our people first.


Every single one of us is in this because of the opportunity at hand. Over a trillion digital images were taken in 2017, and smartphone cameras are only getting stronger. Photos are people’s #1 social asset. The company that figures out how to tap into people’s photos and uses them to create innovative and affordable photo decor will completely change the photo industry. We believe our hard work and innovation will make that happen.

items.content:
Remote React/NodeJS Developer

About this job

Job description

US based candidates only.

About You:

Looking for a unique work environment and culture to thrive in? Do you love the sense of accomplishment in launching a new website? Are you a motivated individual who works well independently as well as on a team? Then we want you!

About Dealer Inspire

Dealer Inspire is an automotive website platform provider located in Naperville, Illinois. We pride ourselves in having a fun, unconventional working environment and a great culture. While our team works extremely hard, we try to keep it a fun and creative work environment. At Dealer Inspire, we like to look at current problems and 'rethink' about solutions. We're flexible - we don't write requirements in stone, and things can change regularly. This means rethinking how the solutions work best. Do you want to come 'rethink' with us?

Job Description

Dealer Inspire is looking for experienced developers to join our team. We're always innovating - we're looking for people that can own projects and see them through to delivery - while we want rock stars, we're not interested in prima donnas. Personal responsibility with respect to quality, attention to detail, and contribution of ideas is highly needed to succeed.

We are building a new team and a new product at Dealer Inspire! Management of automotive inventory is a core piece of functionality for our customer’s websites and the various products that we develop, and because we are just getting started you can have a big impact on the technologies that we use. You will be helping us architect and develop a large and highly complex system for processing inventory feeds as well as developing a brand new product to allow our customers the ability to configure and manage every aspect of their inventory.

Skills & Requirements

We're flexible with learning on the job, with corresponding relevant work experience - but, for this position to be successful we need you to know the following, with a strong self-initiative to learn from others!

Essential Responsibilities (including but not limited to):

  • Assist with debugging / development of bug fixes - day-to-day maintenance
  • Development of new features under the guidance of more senior team members.
  • Function as “project owner” for some new or existing projects, managing initial requirements, feature requests, and long term support.

Required:

  • 1+ years experience with front-end technologies such as React, Redux, and Webpack.
  • Mastery of HTML and CSS/SASS/Styled Components
  • 1+ years experience working with NodeJS
  • Experience with NodeJS frameworks like Express or StrongLoop
  • 1+ years experience working with MySQL or any NoSQL database; the ability to write efficient queries and benchmark/profile them
  • Strong understanding of asynchronous programming
  • Understanding of local development environments and integration of varying components.
  • Experience with performance debugging and benchmarking
  • Git version control
  • Experience with testing frameworks like karma, mocha, or jest
  • Strong attention to design detail. Matching markup/layout with mockups, and making them better. Knowing when things are off (even by a couple pixels) - and knowing why that impacts the experience negatively.
  • Strong communication skills.

Highly Desired:

  • Experience working remotely
  • Familiar with functional programming
  • Performance debugging and benchmarking
  • High sensibility to UI design and UX

Compensation:

$80,000 - $110,000 per year based upon skill and previous experience. Motivated and talented individuals may advance quickly in our fast growing company.

Perks:

  • Health and Dental Insurance Plans
  • 50% match of your 401 k contributions up to 6% of your gross income
  • 10 days paid time off, 4 days of sick/safe leave and selected paid holidays
  • Work time/Fun time quarterly team outings
  • Coaching and career building
  • Subsidized gym membership
  • Subsidized internet access for your home
Apply now

Dealer Inspire is an automotive website platform provider located in Naperville, Illinois. We pride ourselves in having a fun, unconventional working environment and a great culture. While our team works extremely hard, we try to keep it a fun and creative work environment. At Dealer Inspire, we like to look at current problems and 'rethink' about solutions. We're flexible - we don't write requirements in stone, and things can change regularly. This means rethinking how the solutions work best. Do you want to come 'rethink' with us?

Wir suchen Dich!

Du bist leidenschaftliche(r) Developer(in) und hast Lust auf einen interessanten Job in der Games-Branche?

Zur Unterstützung unseres Teams suchen wir deutschlandweit ab sofort einen erfahrenen

App-Entwickler (m/w) Browsergames

im HOMEOFFICE in Vollzeit (40 h/Woche)

Deine Aufgaben:

  • Weiterentwicklung einer auf Adobe Air / ActionScript 3 basierenden App.
  • Betreuung, Neu- und Weiterentwicklung unserer Applikationen und Browsergame-Projekte

Dein Profil:

  • Du kennst Dich sehr gut mit Adobe Air/ActionScript 3 und Starling & Feathers Framework aus?
  • Du hast gute Kenntnisse in den gängigen Scriptsprachen HTML, CSS, PHP, Cake PHP 1-3 und JavaScript (inkl. Node.js)?
  • Du bist sicher im Umgang mit modernen Datenbanken wie MySQL 5/7?
  • Du hast Erfahrungen gesammelt mit Unity 3D, Phonegap/Ionic-Framework, Nativescript oder ReactNative?
  • Du bist ein Teamplayer, der es gewohnt ist eigenverantwortlich, strukturiert und professionell zu arbeiten?
  • Du hast Spaß an komplexen Projekten und abwechslungsreichen Herausforderungen?

Wir bieten Dir:

  • Spannende und vielseitige Projekte in einem aufgeschlossenen und motivierten Team
  • Faire Bezahlung und Wertschätzung
  • Einen ansprechenden, zukunftsfähigen Arbeitsplatz im Homeoffice

Dein Interesse geweckt?

Dann übersende uns Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung an: bewerbung@spielwerk.eu

Bei Fragen steht unser Mitarbeiter, Klaus Stumpp, telefonisch zur Verfügung: 0800 / 269326975

Wir freuen uns auf Dich!

Über Spielwerk GmbH

Apply now

About Spielwerk GmbH

Seit der Gründung unseres Unternehmens 2010 haben wir uns nicht nur einen guten Ruf in der Unterhaltungs- und Gaming-Branche erarbeitet, sondern sind auch gesund gewachsen. Die Erfahrung, die wir über die Jahre gesammelt haben, ist die Basis der kontinuierlichen Verbreiterung unserer Geschäftsfelder. In den vergangenen Jahren erweiterten wir unser Leistungsspektrum um die Beratung, Konzepterstellung, Realisierung und Vermarktung mobiler Applikationen.

items.content:
JOB TYPE: Long Term
3+ months

EXPERIENCE: expert

SKILLS:
• Python
• Javascript
• Django
• HTML5
• ReactJS
• CSS

Screenly, the digital signage company, seeks a front-end developer to help create a great looking modern and responsive web UI. We're looking for people who are ambitious and deeply driven to make a difference.

Your ability as a general pragmatic developer and fast learner is what truly matters to us. As you read the specifics below, keep in mind that the skill we are looking for is more in the lines of "awesome solver of challenges" than any one specific skill.

You would work on JavaScript, React, HTML, CSS and other techs to create a great looking modern and responsive web driven UI. You would also be ready to dive into the Django and Python underpinnings and add the bits necessary for a great user experience. Underneath it all you'll find Postgres, Redis and a good heaping of Docker.

While this ad is about the front-end, we're really into jacks-of-all trades. We think in a startup every team member needs to be nimble and flexible enough to do whatever it takes to deliver the product.

You can expect to work with a small full time team of crafty developers, in a quickly growing startup. We're a remote only shop so you'll never feel you're not in the loop due to not being in the main office -- there is no main office!

You like:

* Detail oriented front-end work.
* Great UX.
* Occasionally fun UI and UX.
* Unit tests, integration tests, ui tests, test tests, every test.
* Python.

This is a full-time position. We only hire individuals, not agencies. Please state the square root of twenty five in your cover letter. You will need to attend a daily meeting and a fortnightly video planning meeting (around 16:00 UTC) so please don’t apply if that doesn’t work for you or you can’t work a semi-regular 5-day week. Hours are very flexible, but you do have to be around often enough for the rest of the team to interact with you.

To be considered for the role, please provide the answer to the following two questions:

* On http://gist.github.com, post a short snippet of code (less than 1 screen) that you're proud of and tell us what's great about it.
* What do you think about the new Python syntax which was just announced?

items.content:
Software Engineers

Developer
Anywhere in Americas, Europe, Africa
Company: Wikimedia Foundation
ContractFull Time

Overview

We’re looking for developers who want to help us build software that serves the world. Our team is hiring for two roles: the first role is for  and the second role is for . Both roles are great work for developers earlier in their professional software engineering career who want to become full stack software engineers building systems that scale. You will help make Wikipedia and Wikimedia Commons better products for our users.

frontend web software engineering (full-time position)test engineering (contract)

The  position entails work on user experiences for the Multimedia team. You will write JavaScript, CSS, and frontend PHP that helps power experiences on sites like Wikimedia Commons.

frontend web software engineering (full-time position)

The  position will focus on test automation, manual testing, and in some cases building user experiences with the Web team.

test engineering (contract)

Are you ready to write open source code that helps to create “”, provides value in people’s lives, and happens to power one of the most popular web destinations in the world?  We are a family friendly and remote friendly employer and have a . We look forward to your application.

a world in which everyone can freely share in the sum of all knowledgegreat benefits package

When applying, please specify which role(s) you are interested in.

We value these things:
  • Clearly and concisely communicating complex ideas about software and software development
  • Authoring polished JavaScript, CSS, and PHP
  • Instrumenting new and core features and maintaining a set of key performance indicators
  • Profiling, analyzing, and optimizing code for performance and user experience on a wide variety of devices

    • Requirements:
    • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or management information systems (or related area) or software bootcamp certification; or equivalent in related work experience
    • Knowledge in JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, and modern web standards
    • A drive to advocate for the adoption of modern web standards and mobile-friendly design
    • A desire to create features for everyone, everywhere and to optimize at the intersection of performance and user perception
    • An interest in working with legacy software and modernizing code
    • Interest in focused software engineering: writing unit tests, reviewing code and responding to code reviews, and discussing architectural approach
    • Experience with testing software
    • A love of free knowledge and open access

      • Pluses:
      • Experience with editing Wikipedia and/or wikitext
      • Open source contribution
      • Experience developing web applications with PHP
      • Knowledge of DOMs
      • Experience with test automation (e.g., Cucumber, Selenium, WebdriverIO, Ruby)
      • Patience

        • Code

        If you have any existing open source software that you’ve developed (these could be your own software or patches to other packages), please share the URLs for the source. Links to your projects on GitHub, GitLab, BitBucket, etc. are exceptionally useful.

        The Wikimedia Foundation is… 

        …the nonprofit organization that supports Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

        The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply

        Benefits & Perks *
        • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)
        • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more
        • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary
        • Flexible and generous time off – vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays – including the last week of the year.
        • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.
        • For those emergency moments – long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program
        • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses
        • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available
        • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax
        • Great colleagues – diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

          • * for benefits eligible staff, benefits may vary by location

          More information

          WMF

          Blog

          Annual Report – 2017

items.content:
NEXT Trucking is a venture-backed company boldly taking on the challenge of digitizing the $450B freight trucking industry. Our technology is transforming the way shippers and truckers engage and communicate by creating an on-demand platform where shippers can instantly find truckers with capacity and be able to have real time tracking updates and transparency with the movement of their freight throughout the entire shipping process.

NEXT was founded by Lidia Yan and Elton Chung with over 20 + years of experience in logistics and technology. We have raised over $21M led by Sequoia Capital. We have assembled a team with experience from companies such as Apple, C.H. Robinson, Idealab, Kareo and GoFundMe. Come join us as we innovate the transportation industry.

You will be a founding member of our Data Platform Team at NEXT Trucking. The mission of this team is to: 1) build large scale fault tolerant data collection and processing pipelines from the ground up, 2) develop software services that leverage data and machine learning to drive business; and improve customer satisfaction within our flagship products, 3) identify and leverage third party data feeds to improve our overall data offerings.

The ideal candidate will have a passion for the craft of software development. This person has a track record of delivering exceptional technical solutions in a fast-paced high growth software company. This person thrives in a startup environment where every individual has a significant impact on the technology and is empowered to make decisions and get things done.

Our stack: AWS, MySQL, React/Native, Java Microservices, Kafka, Continuous Delivery, Dark DeployExperience- About 3+ years of experience developing commercial grade software.- Cross domain experience with AWS.- Motivated by a sense of urgency, ownership, and getting things done.- Strong verbal and written communication skills and able to communicate effectively to technical and non-technical team members.- BS Degree in Computer Science or related field; or equivalent professional experience.Preferred- Graduate degree in Computer Science.- Strong sense of customer empathy.Next Trucking Benefits- Competitive Base Salary and Equity- Full Medical, Dental and Vision Benefits- 401K w/ company match- Vacation and Holidays- Join a rapidly growing technology company disrupting the trucking industry

Company: Integration X A/S | Copenhagen, Denmark

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Copenhagen +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Copenhagen, Denmark. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

javascript
design
reactjs
cloud
saas

Job description

We’re looking for curious, intelligent and dedicated engineers with great communication skills who are excited to take our solutions to the next level.

This is a unique opportunity to be in the driver’s seat and your initiatives and decisions will drive our products forward. You will be working as part of our international development team on our ADPOINT and PLANPOINT solutions.

You can work from home, but must be based in Europe.

Responsibilities

You will be responsible for maintaining and building web application front-ends, from design to deployment.

  • Design, build, test, and deliver web applications and functionality as part of our existing solutions as well as building completely new solutions.
  • True ownership of both internal and customer solutions.
  • Focus on design, usability and intuitiveness in your work.
  • Participate in technical decision-making, helping to bring our technology into the future as well as adding new technologies and frameworks when appropriate.
  • Analyze, investigate and fix issues discovered by our team and our customers.

Skills & Requirements

  • At least 3 year of experience and proven success with advanced web production system development.
  • You are a JavaScript expert and have deep knowledge of one or more JavaScript frameworks. We use React, so knowing that would be a bonus.
  • Extensive experience with digital advertising standards (i.e. IAB)
  • You have an eye for details and are proud of your work.
  • Passionate about building clean and easy-to-use interfaces.
  • Strong analytical and technical skills to identify critical and impacting issues, escalate them and drive them to resolution.
  • Solid experience with test-frameworks like Junit, TestNG, Mockito or similar.

General requirements

  • Fluent in English.
  • Must be based in Europe.
  • Take our company’s success personally.
  • Self-driven and will figure out what jobs need to get done and do them.
  • Exceptionally helpful and service-minded to both our customers and your colleagues.

Please note, this is a Full-time position.

Apply now

About Integration X A/S

Integration X is a leader in software solutions for the media industry. Our customers are in both Europe and the United States and your colleagues come from more than 5 countries. You’ll be working in a small, fast-paced and international developer team making a big impact at a fast-growing company. 

Benefits

  • Flexible work situation
  • Work from home or from one of our offices
  • Benefit from a fast moving, flat organizational structure
  • Get instant feedback on ideas from tech and product management
  • Work with dedicated professionals who depend on your skills

items.content:
Front-End Web Developer with WordPress Experience

Part-time
Long Beach, CA
Remote job
Small business
Posted Today – Accepting applications

We are Advant Interactive, a group of design and developer nerds. We’re a small bunch so far but we have plans for world domination. We’re based in Long Beach, just a Kobe 3-pointer from the beach, and a taxi ride from the heart of LA. We are on the lookout for an individual who seeks a position at the cutting edge of web development. All candidates must work with speed and enjoy sweating over tight deadlines. They must live to code and not be happy until they’ve seen a project through from insemination to birth to that first day at kindergarten.

Who are you? The dude (or dudette) for the role should have a minimum of two years in the world of web development, with a portfolio that’s likely to blow our socks off.

Because we live in the virtual world, it does not matter where you reside, as long as you are available during business hours. Still reading?

Can you tick these boxes?

● You are a Wordpress Whiz and have extensive knowledge/experience with front-end work.
● You’re a dab hand in JavaScript/jQuery (If you can write plugins as well then that’s a bonus, but you must be able to write and implement small-to-medium scripts at least)
● You’re an old pro in writing raw HTML and CSS (especially HTML5 and CSS3)
● You’re used to developing in a LAMP environment
● You’re on-the-button with current Web standards, optimization techniques and best practices
● You’re full of knowledge regarding Twitter Bootstrap and Foundation
● You’re a web developer with two or more years of professional industry experience

And it goes without saying You can both talk the talk and walk the walk. You have 20:20 vision when it comes to fine details. You consider missing a deadline one of the seven deadly sins. If you’ve gotten this far, you could be just what we’re looking for. Send us your portfolio and we’ll talk.

Frontend Web Developer at DI.FM

Remote | International

Overview

DI.FM is seeking a talented Frontend Web Developer proficient in HTML/CSS and Javascript for a full-time position in the Product Development group. This is a fully remote position, meaning the right person will be able to manage their own time (read: working from home isn’t for everyone).

Responsibilities

  • Plan, execute and demonstrate your work on on web and mobile web applications within the DI portfolio.
  • Be accountable and manage your own time; we don’t watch the clock, we just want great work.
  • Participate actively in the entire development process, from ideation to testing and release.
  • Actively engage with members of the wider team to drive tasks to completion.

Requirements/Experience

  • 3-5 years’ web development experience.
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related field.
  • Intermediate experience with modern HTML/CSS and Javascript, including common libraries/frameworks.
  • Basic experience in Photoshop; at least familiarity enough to understand UI assets.
  • Moderately skilled with Ruby on Rails.
  • Knowledge of web development best practices (accessibility, cross-browser compatibility, etc)
  • Passion for music.
  • Communicate clearly in written and spoken English.

Desirable Skills

Intermediate knowledge of Ruby/Rails, Photoshop, Audio decoding/processing, git/git hub, #!/bin/bash, and Agile Development processes.

Personal Attributes

  • Excellent decision making and problem solving skills.
  • Ability to work in a remote team environment.
  • Self-driven, organized and motivated to deliver results.

Compensation

Salary is determined based on your qualifications and your location – we pay market rates for your area. If you are one of our ideal candidates, let’s talk about how to make this the perfect job for you.

We provide a learning platform that helps teachers and parents meet the educational needs of every student. We are building an online, collaborative, curricular platform with lessons, resources, assessments, and activities created by some of the country's best teachers. Our products provide teachers and school systems with a free, world-class, digital Math and ELA curriculum built by top teachers from around the country. Additionally, we support school systems in bringing the curriculum to life through our proprietary professional learning platform and our national community of instructional leaders. Due to growth, we are looking to add a Senior Ruby on Rails Software Developer to join our friendly and collaborative team! * * * Candidates must live in the US and we are unable to provide or transfer sponsorship at this time* * * Top Reasons to Work with Us 1. We have been profitable since day 1 and provide the educational space an advanced and easy to use learning platform 2. Founded by proven entrepreneurs and backed by well-known investors, we are approaching a million users that use our product 3. Award winning in our space (Ranked #5 in our niche) 4. Additionally, you will be responsible for designing and developing full-stack software applications as well as scaling our applications as our user base continues to grow. Our Stack: •Ruby on Rails 5 (HAML, SASS, and Webpack) •Ruby 2 •Postgres •Elasticsearch •Redis •Sidekiq •GitHub, Code Climate, Circle CI, and automated QA test suite written by our world-class QA team What You Need for this Position BSCS or equivalent degree or experience 5+ years of professional full-stack web application development experience Must Have Skills Needed: •4+ years of experience with Ruby on Rails Development •Modern JavaScript Framework (such as Angular, React, Backbone, Knockout) •Experience with PostgreSQL, HTML/CSS •Familiarity with Memcached or similar (ideally 1+ year of exp.) •An appreciation for the best Agile practices including continuous integration and unit testing Nice to Haves: •Elasticsearch, Redis, Sidekiq •SaaS exp. items.content:
TechINT Solutions Group (TSG) is currently looking for a Remote Piloted Vehicles (RPV)/Technical Intelligence Analyst with an active TS/SCI clearance to join our team.
Remote Piloted Vehicles (RPV)/Technical Intelligence Analyst (TS/SCI - Must Be Obtainable)Location: Aberdeen Proving Ground, MD US

Job Category: Intelligence
Security Clearance: TS/SCI or obtainable.

TechINT Solutions Group (TSG) is currently looking for a Remote Piloted Vehicles (RPV)/Technical Intelligence Analyst with an active/obtainable TS/SCI clearance to join our team.

TechINT is a multi-faceted company specializing in Intelligence Analyses, Open Source Intelligence, Counter Remotely Piloted Vehicle, and Counter Terrorism services. TechINT is known for bringing novel approaches and highly skilled professionals, analysts, and trainers to meet demanding customer needs.

Job Description:

Perform supervisor or operator RESPONSIBILITIES for remote piloted vehicles (RPVs-ground/air) and supporting systems to gather intelligence for mission planning, mission sensor/payload operations, launching, remotely piloting, and recovering remote piloted ground and air vehicle systems.

POSITION SUMMARY:

Under close supervision, provides basic level on-site technical support for customer/company network systems. Performs non-routine installation and/or maintenance assignments.

RESPONSIBILTIES:

Perform intelligence collection, analysis, and dissemination of technologies used in RPV's

Responsible for coordination and scenario-development during Department of Defense (DoD) technology test events.

Defines vulnerabilities and critical infrastructure in regards to threats by RPV.

Responsible for the acquisition, fabrication, modification, programming, and maintenance of RPV for test events.

Deploys and redeploys the RPV ground and air systems.

Launches and recovers the air vehicle, performs pre-flight, in flight and post-flight checks and procedures.

Participates in all working groups, planning meetings, conferences, and briefings as a key member of the C-RPV community of interest.

Required Qualifications:

TS/SCI Must be obtainable

BA/BS and 6 years of relevant RPV experience; or AA or 2 years Technical School and 8 years of RPV relevant experience; or High School and 12 years of RPV relevant experience;

Certified FAA UAS Pilot License or substituted for years of UAV/UAS pilot experience.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

Normal demands associated with an office environment. Ability to work on computer for long periods, and communicate with individuals by telephone, email and face to face. Some travel may be required.

items.content:
Front-End Engineer at Grubhub

Remote

Job Locations

US-Remote | US-IL-Chicago | US-NY-New York

Job ID

2018-5096

Category

Technology

About The Opportunity

We’re Grubhub, the nation’s leading online and mobile food ordering company. Since 2004 we’ve been connecting hungry diners to the local restaurants they love. We’re moving eating forward with no signs of slowing down.

With more than 85,000 restaurants and over 15.6 million diners across 1,600 U.S. cities and London, we’re delivering like never before. Incredible tech is our bread and butter, but amazing people are our secret ingredient. Rigorously analytical and customer-obsessed, our employees develop the fresh ideas and brilliant programs that keep our brands going and growing.

Long story short, keeping our people happy, challenged and well-fed is priority one. Interested? Let’s talk. We’re eager to show you what we bring to the table.

Some Challenges You’ll Tackle

Tens of thousands of hungry Diners utilize our platform daily. Our goal is to make the process of ordering food as easy and seamless as possible. As part of the consumer web application team you’ll be focusing on implementing new features with product, improving the overall performance, and using new & emerging technologies to further business goals.

You Should Have

  • 3-5 years experience building highly-scalable interactive web applications (e-commerce preferred)
  • Extended knowledge of JavaScript
  • History with one of the 3 major web frameworks (React, Vue, Angular)
  • Experience writing object-oriented code, especially in JavaScript. Typescript is a plus!
  • Experience working in a test-driven development
  • Familiar with Agile methodologies
  • Experience working with open source technologies is required and contribution to open source systems is a plus

And Of Course, Perks!

  • Unlimited paid vacation days. Choose how your time is spent.
  • Never go hungry! We provide weekly GrubHub/Seamless credit.
  • Regular in-office social events, including happy hours, wine tastings, karaoke, bingo with prizes and more.
  • Company-Wide Initiatives encouraging innovation, continuous learning and cross-department connections.

Grubhub is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster is available here: DOL Poster. Grubhub is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to TalentAcquisition@grubhub.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information

items.content:
Experienced Front-end Developer

Company: Worthy Financial, Inc.
Location: Boca Raton, FL, USA, Remote
Job type: Full-time

Company description

We are Worthy - and so are you! We want to democratize capital by making money more accessible for those who need to borrow it and by making investments with strong returns available to those who would like a better financial future.



We want to help people grow a nest egg even if they think they can’t… and to do it while supporting Main Street, not Wall Street!



Our first product is a free micro-investment app that helps you save & grow your money – $10 at a time. It monitors your everyday spending and rounds up each transaction to a whole dollar. When round-ups reach $10, it then automatically invests it into a 5% interest earning bond, which in turn supports small creditworthy businesses across the U.S., helping to strengthen our local communities. Of course, one can always manually purchase bonds, or even set up recurring investments.



We are a small, seed-stage, remote-first company with offices in sunny Boca Raton, Florida. We avoid the noise of Slack, but we use Twist, Keybase and Confluence to keep in sync. We use Gitlab to take advantage of their integrated CI pipeline and issue tracker (we love to automate stuff!).

Job description

Who we are

We are Worthy - and so are you! We want to democratize capital by making money more accessible for those who need to borrow it and by making investments with strong returns available to those who would like a better financial future.

We want to help people grow a nest egg even if they think they can’t… and to do it while supporting Main Street, not Wall Street!

Our first product is a free micro-investment app that helps you save & grow your money – $10 at a time. It monitors your everyday spending and rounds up each transaction to a whole dollar. When round-ups reach $10, it then automatically invests it into a 5% interest earning bond, which in turn supports small creditworthy businesses across the U.S., helping to strengthen our local communities. Of course, one can always manually purchase bonds, or even set up recurring investments.

We are a small, seed-stage, remote-first company with offices in sunny Boca Raton, Florida. We avoid the noise of Slack, but we use Twist, Keybase and Confluence to keep in sync. We use Gitlab to take advantage of their integrated CI pipeline and issue tracker (we love to automate stuff!).

Who you are

You’re an experienced front-end web developer who has worked for 3+ years on a few production web and hybrid-mobile apps. Experience building financial or accounting applications preferred.

You've built apps using Vue.js, or you have a couple personal projects you can show. You appreciate its simplicity versus other frameworks, but you can also talk about the differences.

You've used Vuex to manage state in your apps, and remember when axios replaced vue-resource for making HTTP calls. You like to keep app logic and state separate from visual components, where possible.

You write unit tests for your Vuex modules, and you've played around with end-to-end testing for UI components. You've tried either Flowtype or Typescript for static typing, and have a strong opinion (loosely held) for one or the other. Your IDE helps you lint as you type, but you still like to run code through a linter before a git commit.

You're aware of the best UI practices for both web and mobile apps. You like hamburgers (veggie or meaty), but not in your navigation menus, if you can help it. You've skimmed through the Material Design guidelines, and have glanced at Apple's HIGs. You know how to build a good form on both large and small screens, and you care about reducing cognitive load for users.

You appreciate that dribbble is a great place to find visual inspiration and fresh ideas. However, you understand that realistic designs which solve real business problems are better than form-over-function portfolio pieces. You know your way around Sketch, Framer, Figma, Adobe XD or other vector-based prototyping tools. You know the basics of microinteractions and how to use animations to improve the user experience, not hinder it. You know when to implement transitions in CSS, how to use Vue's <transition> and friends, and when something like Velocity or mo.js would do the trick.

You've used Cordova to bundle a simple web app into native packages for iOS and Android. You've been curious about attempts to bridge Javascript and native code, such as React Native or Nativescript.

Most importantly, you can communicate clearly and efficiently in writing, as well as in online video/audio calls. You can handle the async (over)communication requirements of a remote-first environment and can manage your own time and productivity.

For everyone’s sake, you develop on either OS X or a Linux flavor. We don’t do windows.

What you’ll do

We have already launched our web, iOS and Android apps and are beginning to gain traction. We've seen 1,500% user growth in August alone!

We accomplished this by having a single code base for all three apps, which allowed us to launch and scale fast. The time has come to jump to the next level of user experience, and optimize our apps for web and mobile separately.

You will work with the CTO to redesign the web and mobile app layouts, navigation and user flows, while adhering to the existing brand styleguide. Once a good design prototype has been created, you will use the latest version of Quasar Framework to build two versions of the app (web and mobile), while sharing as much of the existing code as possible.

You will also help develop functional prototypes using Nativescript and the recently released Vue.js integration, to explore whether we should upgrade the mobile apps from hybrid to something closer to native.

You will contribute to other design-related tasks, such as improving transactional email templates, or assisting with landing page redesigns across our web properties.

Once you have a grasp on how things currently work, you will take on more responsibilities, such as creating the design direction for future UI updates, but only if that's the type of challenge you're willing to tackle. We know that repetitive work leads to boredom and burnout, so you'll never lack opportunities to step out of your comfort zone!

Other than Vue.js, you are not required to have significant experience with our existing stack, but you need to have the ability and desire to learn.

You must be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident who can legally work in the United States.

What you’ll get

  • you can work remote from anywhere in the world (note the citizenship / residence requirement above!) or from our office in Boca Raton, FL
  • you’ll set your own work schedule, as long as you can deliver and be productive (we prefer two 3-hour focused, uninterrupted work sessions, with morning, lunch and evening communication breaks to stay in sync)
  • competitive salary for a remote position
  • your choice of Apple Macbook or Dell XPS Developer Edition, plus a budget for accessories (keyboard, touchpad, headset, whatever makes you more productive)
  • monthly gym membership, provided you actively use it. Otherwise, running shoes stipend or similar. Stay healthy!
  • health insurance & stock options
Apply now!
