Senior Frontend Developer

Company: Project Admission
Location: Nashville, TN, USA, Remote Allowed
Job type: Full-time
Salary: USD 110000-110000
Skills:
  • CSS
  • DOM
  • ES2017
  • GraphQL
  • HTML
  • Javascript
  • Jira
  • Photoshop
  • SCSS
  • sketch
  • vue

    • Company description

    We are building an improved experience for the buying, selling, and distribution of digital tickets to increase data and revenue. By tracking a ticket’s chain of ownership and expanding distribution we open up revenue, marketing, and data collection opportunities, and create an interest graph that goes beyond event attendees.

    Job description

    Senior frontend web developer - Stock option package, work from home, and flexible benefits.

    The Position: We’re looking for a senior frontend web developer.

    Requirements:

    • Expertise in web development best practices, particularly with:
    • Modern JavaScript, ES2017+
    • Responsive CSS/SCSS
    • HTML and the DOM
    • Vue.js framework and related tools (vuex, vue-router)
    • Comfortable with git and other command line tools

    Preferred (not required) experience with:

    • GraphQL APIs (apollo-client)
    • Familiarity with a backend language / working in a full stack environment; ability to debug APIs
    • Sketch, Photoshop, etc; basic skill sets and experience with such design tools as Sketch and Photoshop
    • Working in an Agile/Kanban environment. We use Jira for our task management, so familiarity with the tool is a plus
    • Experience building Progressive Web Apps (Service Worker and Web Push APIs, offline caching, etc)

    Responsibilities:

    • You will be a senior frontend developer responsible for the frontend web development of our software for both desktop and mobile devices. You will report directly to our CTO, working with both him and our Head of Product on a daily basis, with direct input from our CEO and other key team members.
    • You will not be asked to perform any design duties, but you will be given Sketch and/or Photoshop files with designs and asked to export assets from these programs.

    About Project Admission

    We are a growing technology company based in Nashville, TN that offers its employees transparent salary, stock options, and the option to work from home.

    Project Admission was founded by Stephen Glicken and Jordan Stone to solve for two of the biggest problems facing the live event industry: 70% of attendees at an event are unknown to the event organizers and millions of dollars are being transacted by scalpers without any benefit to musicians, teams, or event organizers.

    We’ve built software that acts as the digital layer between a ticketing company and ticket purchasers, allowing us to track ownership and capture resell revenue.

    Our vision: To universally improve the transfer of digital assets.

    Our mission statement: Creating a more connected experience for the buying, selling, and distribution of digital assets.

    Location: Project Admission is based in Nashville, TN. Living in Nashville is not required, but this is a great place to live thanks to no state income tax, a relatively low cost of living, and a booming city with great food and culture, to name a few.

    Salary: 110,000/year

    Why Should You Apply?

    • Flexible benefits
    • Regular hours
    • Unlimited vacation
    • Work from home
    • Career growth opportunity
    Apply now!

Frontend Developer in Copenhagen

Company: ConsortiaManager
Location: Copenhagen, Denmark
Job type: Full-time
Salary: USD 50000-80000
Skills:
  • jQuery
  • Laravel
  • vue js

    • Company description

    ConsortiaManager started in 2014 as a public-private innovation project with the Danish Ministry of Culture (Kulturstyrelsen). Now just four years later, the company serves more than 2,500 libraries around the world including all the Swedish, Danish and South African university libraries and even all the Ivy League universities in the United States. We are a great team of 8 people from Italy, Sweden, Ukraine, Denmark, UK, and the Faroe Islands having a lot of fun besides building great products.

    Job description

    Are you looking to be employee number nine in a fast growing start-up that already has Stanford University, the University of Luxembourg and the United Nations on the customer list?

    You will get a lot of responsibility, play a key role for a new product and be part of a dedicated team meaning you can affect the direction of the application, gain more professional skills and also grow as an individual.

    Responsibilities

    Your responsibilities will include helping to design and develop the frontend of the system with a focus on creating a high performing, user-friendly experience for our customers. Our core users work with the system for several hours each day; so every detail and every improvement counts.

    Technical skills

    A candidate that we will consider must have…

    • Minimum 3-5 years’ experience building elegant, efficient, and reusable JavaScript code
    • High confidence in working with vue.js and jQuery
    • Experience working in a team and using Git (or another version control system)
    • An intolerance for ugly web pages and bad UI´s – you can show us examples of things you have fixed and/or would fix if given the opportunity

    A candidate that we will consider might have…

    • An understanding of object oriented PHP and general MVC principles
    • Some experience with Laravel
    • Some experience with MySQL
    • Some experience with handling large data sets
    • Experience with visualization of complex data in an user-friendly way
    • A degree in Computer Science or other relevant formal education

    Soft skills

    A candidate that we will consider must ...

    • Be fluent in speaking, reading & writing English
    • Take pride in the work they do
    • Have experience working closely in teams
    • Be self-driven and motivated
    • Be willing to learn and adjust as tasks and requirements change
    • Live in or close to Copenhagen (or be willing to relocate)

    Danish is not required

    Perks

    • Competitive salary
    • Great office at Lergravsvej in Copenhagen close to public transportation and free parking
    • Company paid lunch
    • Possibility for some remote work
    • Team activities and social events
    Apply now!

items.content:
Senior Front End Engineer

Company: Agrando
Location: Munich, Germany
Job type: Full-time
Salary: EUR 54000-85000
Skills:
  • Bulma
  • CircleCI
  • Django
  • Docker
  • Github
  • Google Cloud
  • Jest
  • Node
  • Nuxt.js
  • Python
  • Sentry
  • Slack
  • Vue.js
  • Webpack
  • SASS

    • Company description

    Agrando is an independent SaaS trading platform for farmers and retailers. Our vision is a borderless network of farmers and retailers - no matter what size or region - who work together to overcome current and future challenges of digitization. Our core features include digital channels to trade agricultural inputs and in-depth data analytics and benchmarking functionalities about individual trading economics. Agricultural trading today is characterised by analogue and cumbersome processes and a fundamental lack of transparency. We are creating a future for farmers and retailers in which they are able to share data in an anonymous and secure way, work together and do business smarter.

    Job description

    We’re looking for a Senior Front End Engineer that has a passion for hacking, building and owning a great product with high-end customer facing features, internal tools and experiences that help us and our customers become smarter. You have a proven track record of writing clean and performant code with emphasis on user accessibility.

    Why you should work with us

    Agrando is a project absolutely dear to our heart. We act by conviction in order to contribute to the progress of agriculture. Our main cause is to support the farmer because in the end, it's all about mutual care and cooperation. Agriculture is our home and our origin and we speak from our own experience and know about the specific needs, which makes us the perfect partner for the agricultural trading of the next centuries. We want to push the agricultural trade forward using state of the art technologies and constantly stay in motion by taking one step at a time while being excited about everything that comes along. Working with us means to make a difference and to help us developing a meaningful product that in the end has an impact on the future of sustainable agriculture and thus the food you eat everyday.

    What you should bring

    • Great communication skills, ability to work in an agile team and workflow experience (git-flow, scrum, etc.)
    • 2+ years proven JS work experience in a professional or institutional environment (including usage of node/npm/yarn)
    • Demonstrable experiences with Vue.js (or at least one out of the following: Backbone/Ember/Angular/React)
    • Demonstrated facility in a HTML/CSS/SASS/LESS environment
    • General understanding of core computer programming, distributed systems, logic & cloud infrastructure
    • Open-mindedness and an attitude that encourages nurturing your skills, learning new ones while at the same time passing on knowledge in areas you excel
    • Passion for writing quality, high-performance and maintainable code following best practices by heart
    • Farming experience (just joking but having played Farming Simulator does count)

    What to expect

    As a Senior Front End Engineer at Agrando you will support us in the creation of our SPA frontend for the stakeholders on our trading platform (farmers, retailers, producers). You will make technologies or frameworks like Jest, Bulma and SASS work for you and learn about how to contribute to our CI/CD Pipelines supporting our DevOps specialists. Most importantly, you will deep dive into latest JavaScript frameworks since our frontend core is based on Vue.js, Nuxt.js (apart from having an SPA part we also use SSR on top of Vue), Vuex, Axios, REST APIs and GraphQL. You will improve the UX and UI together with our Designers and guide them in their implementation efforts to align the product to their design philosophies. On the other hand, you will directly influence decisions supporting our DevOps, Analytics, Design and Product Department while keeping yourself in sync with the Sales & Marketing team.

    Since future logic is also driven by our data intensive infrastructure it is a plus if you want to get in touch with other parts of our product like our BI & Big Data Pipeline (GCP) and Machine Learning strategies. We constantly explore latest technologies to find the best solutions to our next-gen problems - thus hacking around and bringing in your own ideas is something we highly encourage.

    Perks

    • Remote & Flexible: It is possible to work from home if physical presence is not needed and we have a non-clock-watching culture.
    • Events Around the Globe: Since we are an aspiring AgTech Startup you can join us on various Trips, Conventions, Conferences (We just went to Vue.js Amsterdam and it has been a total blast), Tech Fairs, Trade Shows and other Events around the World, related to our business or the technologies involved.
    • Make a Difference: In the end we try to save our farmers money by purchasing agricultural inputs more cost-efficiently, which in turn can save farms with less revenues than production costs from bankruptcy (e.g. coming from low milk prices), while at the same time enabling private suppliers to compete and advance in the digitized agricultural trade of the future.
    • Equity Grants: We grant incentives (company shares) to employees that influence and push our company success in the long-term.
    • Advanced Training: At Agrando we believe in nurturing our skills through proper knowledge management and personal development. We encourage our employees to learn, teach and improve also through advanced trainings, workshops, (hosted) meetups or other external activities and provide them with the best resources (Udemy for Business, Nanodegrees from Udacity) for free.
    • Additional Benefits: Weapons of choice (MBP etc.), Coffee & Beer, Organic Fruits & YumYum Soups, SNES & XBOX360 Gaming

    Social

    • Frequent weißwurst breakfasts (Max Muniger Gold - best weißwurst in town)
    • Agrando summer & winter parties
    • Mandatory Agrando-Tables at the Oktoberfest & Frühlingsfest
    • We are not your average team - there are no fancy HR phrases that could properly describe our working atmosphere and team spirit. Everyone is passionate about the company and our cause and we do our best every day. Although we distance ourselves from the hip berlin-casual-startup-family-work-hard-party-hard-stuff, we are more than colleagues and Agrando is more than just our workplace. An employee turnover of 0% should speak for itself but believe us when we say that within the first few weeks we will win your heart!
    Apply now!

items.content:
Senior Frontend Engineer

Company: Upmind Automation Limited
Location: London, UK
Job type: Full-time
Skills:
  • Amazon Web Services
  • Bulma
  • Javascript
  • SPA
  • vue js
  • Vue router
  • Vuex
  • Angular
  • Buefy
  • Firebase
  • Google Cloud
  • Jest
  • karma
  • nightwatch
  • React js
  • Webpack

    • Company description

    Upmind is a client management, product management and billing platform for small and medium service businesses. We’re moving our customers away from manual spreadsheets, tedium and stress - to a radically new platform with simple UI, infinite scalability and beautiful code.

    Job description

    Upmind is a client management, product management and billing platform for small and medium service businesses. We’re moving our customers away from manual spreadsheets, tedium and stress - to a radically new platform with simple UI, infinite scalability and beautiful code.

    Spun out of a multi-billion dollar listed company, and led by entrepreneurs and developers with a proven history in startups, our biggest challenge is making complicated flows, or technical configuration, easy and enjoyable for our users. Our MVP launch will be in early 2019, with frequent rollouts of features indefinitely thereafter.

    We are putting together a frontend development team of crack javascript developers, led by our experienced Director of UX. We are after at least two competent, experienced and technical javascript developers to join our fun, hard-working team. We can accommodate a range of experience, but are ideally after one senior and one junior developer. All applicants should have decent knowledge of a framework such as React, Angular or Vue - however we are set on using the latter and you must be willing to immerse yourself in it, if you are not already.

    You will be based either in our Coworking office at Paddington (WeWork), or our Coworking space in Sofia (Betahaus). We can be flexible with home-working, but some office-based work is essential for this collaborative project.

    Our Stack

    Upmind is an API-first SAAS application, which means our backend handles all logic and exposes a RESTful API. This backend is built on modern cloud technology (largely AWS, though some Google - Firebase & Compute - also). As we develop further, we are microservicing components in such a way that we may be able to offer them as standalone products in the future.

    The backend also makes use of Laravel and NodeJS. We use a combination of SNS and RabbitMQ for messaging, and MySQL/Firestore/DynamoDB for databases. These stack choices are fluid and subject to challenge from any member of staff – for example, if a new product offering from a cloud provider were to emerge. We encourage everyone to speak up and have a say; we only want to hire people who bring something extra to the team.

    At Upmind we are great advocates for open source technology, and a substantial portion of our software will be released under GNU GPL3.

    Our frontend is built out as a single page application (SPA) atop the Vue JS framework – utilising a number of Vue's core libraries including VueRouter and VueX. Coupled with Bulma, a modern and responsive CSS framework, our primary focus is to deliver a clean, friendly and performant customer experience.

    Joining this team you will have the opportunity to work with some of the latest (and most exciting) frontend technologies, be part of a truly agile workforce and impact the way we work by collectively reviewing and improving processes.

    Responsibilities

    • Create world-class UI solutions which impress
    • Write clean and componentised code, that is reusable and remains efficient at scale
    • Work with our chosen tech: Vue, VueRouter, VueX, Webpack, Buefy
    • Write tests to validate your work (Karma/Jest/Nightwatch etc)
    • Help define and enforce team standards (formatting, documentation, naming conventions etc)
    • Translate wireframes and designs into beautiful and compact code
    • Ensure users have enjoyable, simple experiences - even within complex flows
    • Be vocal with criticism of systems, code and functionality you find fault with
    • Be a team-player: both within your direct function and outside it
    • Maintain the stack – keep on top of dependency vulnerabilities, version releases etc
    • Keep abreast of new technologies, tools and products which could benefit the business

    Person Specification

    • You have 3+ years commercial frontend development experience
    • You have worked in an agile development environment
    • You have an expert knowledge of Javascript/ES6
    • You have working experience of Vue JS or other similar frameworks (React/Angular)
    • You have working experience with build tools such as Webpack
    • You can write tests to validate your work (Karma/Jest/Nightwatch)
    • You are driven and can take ownership of your day-to-day responsibilities
    • You have great communication skills
    • You like to build great products whilst having fun

    Desirable

    • Experience working on mid-to-large scale SPAs
    • Experience with Cloud technologies such as Google Firebase, Google Compute, Google Pub/Sub, AWS Lambda etc
    • A good eye for design and understanding of responsive considerations
    • A willingness to educate and mentor team members

    Benefits

    • Competitive salary, based on experience.
    • A fun but hard-working meritocratic environment, surrounded by a technical, pragmatic and focused team.
    • Premium office space, with free hot, cold and alcoholic drinks. Frequent meals out, office events etc.
    • Opportunity to travel between our offices in London and Bulgaria.
    • Experience with cutting edge technologies, and freedom to investigate development options that may benefit our product.
    • A learning and development budget to support your career progression and improvement.
    Apply now!

items.content:
Senior Front End Developer

Company: Meetupcall
Location: Doncaster, UK, Remote Allowed
Job type: Full-time
Salary: GBP 35000-45000

Company description

Meetupcall is on a mission to make meetings better for everyone, everywhere. Initially founded in 2009 as a conference call provider, Meetupcall has developed a reputation as one of the simplest, smartest and slickest ways to host a conference call, even described by the BBC as so simple to use you may never have a face to face meeting again.

Job description

The primary purpose of the Senior Front End Developer role is to own the front-end development of all Meetupcall's web and mobile app based products. This includes the design, specification, production and testing of fast, elegant and responsive end-user experiences.

As a senior member of the development team, this role will contribute to the future technical and functional direction of the Meetupcall product range and be instrumental in shaping the way Meetupcall develops software.

Responsibilities

  • Produce clean, high quality code and tests.
  • Work along side the UX designer to translate mock-ups and wireframes into fast, elegant and responsive experiences.
  • Embrace and champion software development best practices.
  • Keep up to date with the latest web technologies.
  • Contribute to the product design and planning process.
  • Help develop the technical skills of other developers on the team through mentorship, code reviews and writing documentation.
  • Help develop the technical skills of other developers on the team through mentorship, code reviews and writing documentation.

Requirements

  • Minimum 5 years front-end development experience, including recent exposure to modern Javascript tooling like Webpack, Typescript, ES6 and Babel.
  • In-depth knowledge of a similar modern front-end framework may be considered.
  • Comprehensive understanding of vanilla JavaScript, HTML and CSS.
  • Bonus points for: Design Experience, Awareness of Agile methodologies, Team leading experience, back-end experience.

Tech Stack

Our front-end is written in Typescript, Vue and Vuetify, and bundled with Webpack. It is tested with Cypress and Mocha and it interfaces with our Ruby / Rails and Elixir / Phoenix API.

We are generally using the latest stable version of each language or tool - We diligently try to keep all of our dependencies up to date.

Elsewhere in our stack, we use PostgreSQL, MySQL and Redis, and our telephony platform is built on a modified version of Asterisk. We host on AWS and also make use of other Amazon services such as Lambda.

Benefits

  • Generous Bonus Scheme.
  • Pension Scheme.
  • Quarterly staff events, Free breakfast Fridays, Fun monthly competitions etc.
  • Gym membership.
  • Some remote work may be considered, but frequent presence in the office will be required.
Apply now!

    Build smarter applications. Reduce unnecessary complexity in applications by writing applications as stories that scale horizontally in a serverless+microservice environment.

The successful candidate will be responsible for developing ServiceNow implementations on complex large scale projects, while getting exposure to GRC/SecOps/automation and enterprise orchestration.

This is an excellent opportunity to work with one of Europe's largest and most well-known independent ServiceNow partner and work alongside industry experts.

To be considered for this role you will have ServiceNow Development experience, with a minimum of the core ITIL modules. The candidate will also have experience working with JavaScript, HTML, CSS, XML and ideally HTML5 and Angular. Exposure to working as part of agile teams developing applications for ServiceNow and advising product owners and stakeholders throughout the development process is required.

This is an excellent opportunity to join one of the most successful and competent ITSM consultancies in Europe while working remotely.

items.content:
RTK.io is an advertising and analytics startup working with digital publishers to help them monetize their online ad inventory. The proprietary platform has achieved tremendous scale (tens of billions of web impressions per month) and is deployed to some of the largest publishers in the world.

We're looking for a Senior Javascript Engineer to join our core Engineering Team in Zurich, Switzerland. Remote work is an option for highly qualified candidates.

The Senior Javascript Engineer role at RTK.io encompasses the maintenance and development of an industry leading client-side auctioning system that receives more daily web requests than Twitter! Additionally you will be assisting with the implementation of clients through the deployment and go-live lifecycle of a partnership. Internally, the position requires cross-team collaboration with Sales, Account Management, Product, and Engineering teams. Externally, the position requires consistent interaction with the clients side as the technical expert responsible for assessing and advising on the implementation of RTK.io technology.

Responsibilities:

  • You code in pure Javascript (no frameworks) with years of client side expertise.
  • Lead product development and turn client needs into reality with RTK's'product offerings.
  • You manage day-to-day technical relationships with engineering counterparts at client publishers during integration and preliminary post integration testing
  • Closely interface with Sales, Account Management, Product, and Engineering teams
  • Provide technical expertise during integration lifecycle, including troubleshooting integration related issues, reporting discrepancies, and implementation concerns
  • Review and test integrations to ensure proper implementation
  • Become subject matter expert in RTK's product offerings and be able to explain all technical aspects of products to internal and external stakeholders

What You Need for this PositionPrimary responsibilities include managing the development, testing, and release of one of RTK's core product offerings. Additionaly responsibilities include participating in customer implementations and making improvements to RTK's products based on customer feedback and implementation experience

At Least 3 Years of experience and knowledge of:

  • HTML, CSS
  • Advanced JavaScript

You will get to:

  • Write JavaScript that conducts real-time auctions and measures Ad performance across billions of monthly impressions.
  • Build browser extensions and crawlers that track advertising trends across the web
  • Fight fraudulent ad traffic
  • Architect technical integrations with the world's top technology companies
  • Work in a highly analytical environment and gain exposure to very large big-data systems.
  • Work with customers to implement RTK's technology inside their Content Management Systems.

About You

  • BS in Computer Science, Engineering or other related field
  • Expert knowledge of JavaScript
  • Knowledgeable in best practices and design patterns regarding JavaScript programming
  • Ability to write modular, testable, and readable JS code
  • Familiarity with test frameworks
  • Deep understanding of cross-browser differences, JS performance tradeoffs, and profiling and debugging tools
  • Resourceful, experimentation-driven approach to solving unstructured, data-oriented JS challenges
  • A passion for fast, abstract, maintainable and efficient code

items.content:
Please note we do not sponsor work permit, you must be entitled to work in the UK and no agencies please.

Job Title: Full Stack Developer at ODICCI Interactive Marketing
Hours: Full Time
Joining: Start Immediately
Location: 44 Bedford Row, WC1R 4LL London
Fresh graduates with 3y+ of personal programming/hacking experience welcome.

*ODICCI Platform*
With our Interactive Marketing platform, ODICCI, we help brands like Virgin Holidays, Paperchase, Ryman, Givenchy creating fun and interactive experiences to engage with audiences offline and online.

We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic web developer to help us build fun, intelligent interactive experiences for our Clients and come up with innovative, creative ideas... thinking outside the box. As a developer you’ll have the ability and initiative to help develop our platform. You’ll be able to work within existing guidelines and work with legacy code.

*We are looking for..*
Individuals that have:
Excellent knowledge of at least one object oriented language (Ruby preferred)
Knowledge of Javascript and CSS knowledge
Knowledge of PostGres, SQL, database management
Experience in commercial software development
Familiarity with Agile software development

You are eager to learn and you are used to work in teams. You have a University degree in computer science or equivalent, are London-based or willing to relocate to London and allowed to work in the UK. Please send us examples of your work if you can :-)

A developer with “stay hungry, stay foolish” mindset, who has proven track record of “hacking” from his bedroom/dorm-room for a considerable period of time.

You love knowing and learning new technologies and using them towards practical applications and solving real-life problems and making cool things. Solving that nagging bug, or learning that new intricate package to fit into your codebase keeps you up till late night. You can think and build things from first-principles when necessary, but also know how to use existing packages and join their dots and integrate them well to the desired end.

You should be able pick up things fast as you will have a lot to learn. We encourage you to have a say in business plans and directions our projects take and be able to contribute outside tech. The job requires a good attitude towards problem-solving and debugging, and working under tight-schedule.

You should aim to work 5-5.5 days a week, between our offices in Holborn and working remotely.

We are looking forward to welcoming you to the ODICCI team, make things beautiful, crunch numbers like there’s no tomorrow, release code every day and have a burrito and a beer every so often!!!

*Compensation*
Between £24,000 and £30,000 a year, depending on your experience and skills. You would have a probationary period of 3 months.

Job description

Senior Inventory Management System (IMS) Developer

This position can be remote, but US based candidates only.

About You:

Looking for a unique work environment and culture to thrive in? Do you love the sense of accomplishment of shaping a new product and pushing code daily? Are you a motivated individual who works well independently as well as on a team? Then we want you!

About  Us:

Dealer Inspire is an automotive website platform provider located in Naperville, Illinois. We pride ourselves in having a fun, unconventional working environment and a great culture. While our team works extremely hard, we try to keep it a fun and creative work environment. At Dealer Inspire, we like to look at current problems and 'rethink' about solutions. We're flexible - we don't write requirements in stone, and things can change regularly. This means rethinking how the solutions work best. 

Want to learn more about who we are? Check us out here!

Job Description

Dealer Inspire is looking for experienced developers to join our team. We're always innovating - we're looking for people that can own projects and see them through to delivery - while we want rock stars, we're not interested in prima donnas. Personal responsibility with respect to quality, attention to detail, and contribution of ideas is highly needed to succeed.

Metal℠ is DI's new Inventory Management System (IMS) that fulfills their promise to help automotive retailers future-proof their dealerships across multiple services and platforms. Designed mobile and tablet-first, Metal℠ allows car dealers to quickly and easily manipulate their vehicle inventory and have those changes appear on their Dealer Inspire website in real-time with API synchronization. From easy-to-implement pricing rules to the ability to upload hi-res inventory pictures, Metal℠ offers a full-suite of features that modernize inventory management.

Skills & Requirements

We're flexible with learning on the job, with corresponding relevant work experience - but, for this position to be successful we need you to know the following, with a strong self-initiative to learn from others!

Essential Responsibilities (including but not limited to):

  • Architecture and development of new features.
  • Set and enforce code quality standards and test coverage.
  • Function as “project owner” for some new or existing projects, managing initial requirements, feature requests, and long term support.
  • Leadership and mentoring of junior developers.

Required:

  • 3+ years experience with front-end technologies such as React, Redux, and Webpack.
  • Mastery of HTML and CSS/SASS/Styled Components
  • 3+ years experience working with NodeJS
  • Experience with NodeJS frameworks like Express or StrongLoop
  • 3+ years experience working with MySQL or any NoSQL database; the ability to write efficient queries and benchmark/profile them
  • Strong understanding of asynchronous programming
  • Understanding of local development environments and integration of varying components.
  • Experience with performance debugging and benchmarking
  • Git version control
  • Experience with testing frameworks like karma, mocha, or jest
  • Strong attention to design detail. Matching markup/layout with mockups, and making them better. Knowing when things are off (even by a couple pixels) - and knowing why that impacts the experience negatively.
  • Strong communication skills.

Highly Desired:

  • Experience working remotely
  • Familiar with functional programming
  • Performance debugging and benchmarking
  • High sensibility to UI design and UX

Compensation:

$90,000+ per year based upon skill and previous experience. Motivated and talented individuals may advance quickly in our fast growing company.

Perks:

  • Health and Dental Insurance Plans
  • 50% match of your 401 k contributions up to 6% of your gross income
  • 15 days paid time off, 4 days of sick/safe leave and selected paid holidays
  • Work time/Fun time quarterly team outings
  • Coaching and career building
  • Subsidized gym membership
  • Subsidized internet access for your home
Apply now

About Dealer Inspire

About Dealer Inspire:

Dealer Inspire is an automotive website platform provider located in Naperville, Illinois. We pride ourselves in having a fun, unconventional working environment and a great culture. While our team works extremely hard, we try to keep it a fun and creative work environment. At Dealer Inspire, we like to look at current problems and 'rethink' about solutions. We're flexible - we don't write requirements in stone, and things can change regularly. This means rethinking how the solutions work best. Do you want to come 'rethink' with us?

Benefits

  • Health Insurance with BCBS
  • 401k plan with company match
  • 10 days paid time off, 4 days of sick leave and selected paid holidays
  • Dental, Life and Disability Insurance
  • Subsidized gym membership
  • Subsidized internet access for your home
  • Peer to Peer Bonus program
  • Stocked fridge with snacks and more!

items.title: Full Stack Engineer Business Processes Intelligence For A Real Estate App
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=29, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=24}
items.content:
Full Stack Engineer Business Processes Intelligence For A Real Estate App


Allthings


About your new job:

As a full-stack engineer in our Business Processes & Intelligence team you will work on all parts of the “engine” driving the business processes and business intelligence of Allthings.

This includes building interfaces with our Allthings product platform and several cloud services (e.g. CRM, project management, accounting, mailing), aggregating and enriching their data in our relational database, building custom business apps and tools, and automating all business-relevant processes around them.

You will work together with all teams and departments across the whole company and have a great impact and influence on the way your colleagues will do their daily job.

Working with the data, you will be the go-to person for analytics and business intelligence related questions, and the central enabler for data-driven decision making, from Sales to Customer Success, and from Product Engineering to Finance. You will find your stakeholders along the entire value-chain and customer journey.

What we value:


* A hands-on attitude for quick iterations

* Ability of rapid context switching

* A passion for data - finding the needle in the haystack is a joy for you

* Strong interest in understanding and shaping business operations and processes

* Automate Allthings!




We offer:


* A state-of-the art technology stack (AWS Lambda, Docker, NodeJS, React, TypeScript, PostgreSQL)

* Your choice of laptop and freedom of software development environment

* Competitive salary and industry-standard benefits

* Flexible work time

* A product, which 60 European real estate companies count on after 18 months of market traction

* A product, which was named “best connected home solution 2015” at the 2015 Mobile World Congress in Barcelona

* An experienced management team, a first-class technology and operations team as well as investors, who - together with us - aim to lead in our field globally

* A company culture that fosters “what is right” rather than “who is right”




You have:


* Experience in implementing and working with REST APIs

* Experience with SQL and complex data models, ideally PostgreSQL

* Experience in implementing web applications (front-/back-end)

* Experience with JavaScript/TypeScript and NodeJS, knowledge of AWS/React/Redux/GraphQL/Webpack/MongoDB a plus

* Experience with BI tools, e.g. Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, SSRS

* A university degree or equivalent credibility

* A good sense of humor :)




Workplace:

We are open to remote work, e.g. in Berlin, Freiburg, Frankfurt, Basel, Zürich...

See more jobs at Allthings

items.content:
Who is Fracture?

Fracture is re-inventing the way consumers print and display their digital images. Our first product, printed glass “Fractures”, allow you to print your images directly onto glass and have them shipped right to you in our custom designed packaging. Check it out at Fracture.Me. We’ve sold over 650,000 fractures to almost 200,000+ customers in 50+ countries, but this is just the beginning. We’re just scratching the surface of our potential. Our uniqueness stems from the fact that we actually design, engineer, and manufacture something tangible, 100% in-house. Real. That’s what we love about what we do. We’re blending cutting edge e-commerce with lean manufacturing to make your digital images become real.

Who are we looking for?

The Front End Developer joining our team will be responsible for maintaining our current E-Commerce platform, built on CodeIgniter. These responsibilities will include bug fixes, implementation of new features, new content and updates to existing content as well as upgrading and securing legacy software and APIs.

 

As Fracture migrates to a new E-Commerce platform in 2019, this developer will participate in the planning and development of that website. They will work with our E-Commerce director to create a data translation layer or API which will facilitate communication between our E-Commerce website and our on-site production application and database. This developer will also be a key component of the team as we build out new features, products, and services for our customers.

 

The right person will have excellent communication skills and a strong track record of working in fast-paced, agile environments. They will also take pride in the quality of code that is deployed and that no detail is too fine to be overlooked. The best candidates will have a history of working in E-Commerce where they understand the necessity of A/B testing, strategic planning, and world-class execution in order to provide a superior user and customer experience that accurately reflects our brand.

 

Required Skills

  • Minimum of 6 years development experience
  • Must have experience building and maintaining web applications with PHP MVC frameworks CodeIgniter or Laravel
  • Expert level knowledge of WordPress including theming, plugin development, the WordPress REST API and Customize API
  • Must have familiarity with the implementation and customization of WooCommerce and WooCommerce API
  • Experience working on a high traffic E-Commerce website (1M+ unique/mo)
  • The ability to optimize applications for speed and scalability
  • Must be able to work with Sketch files (Mac-based)
  • Knowledge working with responsive CSS frameworks, preferably Bulma
  • Should understand the importance of excellent documentation and have strong organizational skills

Must be proficient with:

  • PHP
  • MySQL and PostGres
  • HTML5
  • Flexbox and CSS grid
  • CSS Preprocessors, specifically SASS
  • Javascript (ES6) and jQuery
  • Build tools like Gulp, Grunt and/or Webpack
  • CSS methodologies such as BEM, OOCSS or SMACSS
  • GIT

Preferred Skills

  • Experience implementing and strategizing deployment when using testing tools like VWO or Optimizely
  • Background implementing an ERP connection (Sage, SAP) with E-Commerce platforms
  • Background in writing APIs or data translation layers
  • Experience with Node, NPM and React a bonus

Working conditions

 

Remote applicants will be considered for this position. EThe employee will be required to work regular business hours (Eastern time zone) and be on-call as needed nights and weekends.

 

What’s in it for you?

 

We’re offering a competitive salary, equity, and health care benefits – to name the tangibles. As far as the intangibles, we are committed to a safe, positive and enthusiastic culture. We believe our team is the core of everything and we put our people first.

Every single one of us is in this because of the opportunity at hand. Over a trillion digital images were taken in 2017, and smartphone cameras are only getting stronger. Photos are people’s #1 social asset. The company that figures out how to tap into people’s photos and uses them to create innovative and affordable photo decor will completely change the photo industry. We believe our hard work and innovation will make that happen.

About us

Founded in 1997 by Cath Kenyon and Damien Byrne, Kaleida deliver dedicated IT solutions to their clients.

We are experts in Microsoft .NET and SQL Server technologies and our recent clients include Renaker Build, Face For Business, Turner & Townsend and Sofology.

"Their clients love them. So they stay with them"

Your new role
Want to work on exciting projects, emerging technologies, with flexibility & working from home options?

At Kaleida, you will be a key part of our development team, focused on designing and delivering customer solutions mainly using ASP.NET MVC, C#, WebApi, MS SQL, Angular 2+, Typescript, HTML5, CSS3

We want someone who is hungry to explore emerging technologies and understand how they can be used to deliver value to our customers

About you
Several years of varied commercial development experience on the Microsoft stack with excellent C#

Excellent understanding of Object Orientated Programming, SOLID principles, Design Patterns and best practices.

Experience of Developing with Angular 2+ framework, Typescript, Responsive design in CSS

You will be responsible for delivering specified software to agreed quality and time-scales.

What you'll get in return
25 days annual leave
8% pension (5% from employee)
Performance related Bonus
Private Health insurance
Death in Service (3x salary)
Parking
Flexible working
Working from home (after initial period)
Childcare vouchers
Cycle to work

Kaleida work with clients across construction, insurance, leisure and financial sectors have all shared in the benefits of their work developing bespoke high-quality, secure software that streamlines their business, saves them time and makes them money.

Benefits

  • Excellent Daily Rates
  • Committed to Diversity

items.content:
Front End Javascript Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Clevertech | No office location

Technologies

javascript
reactjs
agile

Job description

## DESCRIPTION
Clevertech is looking for a Front End Javascript Engineer to join our global team. In this role you will have significant front end responsibility in one of our project development teams to ensure client satisfaction by using modern design patterns, and cutting edge development thinking including isomorphic code, stateless components, and functional concepts.

Well qualified applicants will have deep experience in the latest libraries and programming techniques. You will have accomplishments that showcase your capabilities by their success and technical depth. You might also have a chance to use React Native, Electron, and Ionic.


---

## REQUIREMENTS


* 3+ years professional experience working with NodeJS
* Strong domain knowledge on web fundamentals like HTML, JavaScript, and CSS
* Comfortable in a test-driven development environment
* Self-motivated, proactive and take ownership of issues
* Thrive and excel in our diverse, distributed and agile team environment
* Knowledge about the Lean Startup and Agile Methodologies
* Strong communicator at a standard of native-speaker in English

Apply now

About Clevertech

BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source

items.content:
Hello, we’re Cornerstone

We sell our own high-quality range of grooming, wellbeing and dental products on a flexible, regular subscription at cornerstone.co.uk. Having started from our founder’s kitchen table a few years ago with a £5,000 loan, we now have 170,000 subscribers around the UK and a team of 30 in our London HQ.

Interview process

Application with your CV and a brief email introducing yourself and your relevant experience.
Phone/Skype interview
A task to complete from home
Face-to-face interview with members of the Product & Tech teams
Face-to-face chat with our founder Ollie

Please note that we will not consider applications without a brief cover letter – we wouldn’t want you to miss out, so do make sure to include a few lines to be considered.

On inclusivity

We’re building a working environment and recruitment process that is open to all sections of society. We’re committed to providing equal opportunities for employment regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic origin, disability, family structure, socio-economic status, age, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis (it's the law, but it also matters to us).
If you have a disability, caring duties, or any other additional need that require considerations, accommodation or adjustments to our role or recruitment process, please do let us know. And if you have suggestions on how we could improve, we’d really like to hear from you.

The role

We're looking for someone to join our 7 person strong development team, help us write excellent code, build lots of new features and support our platform through constant growth.

Develop new user-facing features
Build reusable code and utilities for future use
Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX
Write readable and maintainable code
Develop scalable solutions
Review code written by peers
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders

Your skills

Great understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3
Good understanding of CSS pre-processing platforms
Good understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks
Good understanding of writing unit and integration tests
Good understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX
Basic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image
Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them
Proficient understanding of Git
Good understanding of Accessibility principles and ensuring that application will adhere to them
Ideally UX design experience

Tech stack

The role is for front end, working on a client facing web app. The app is divided into a back end that serves a REST api, and a web front end written in JS, using the following tools:
Node (with ExpressJS)
React/Redux
React Router
Webpack
Babel
We value and work on a TDD approach, supported by the following tools:
Jest (unit tests)
Cypress (integration tests)
We use Mac computers, our stack runs on AWS, we use a continuous integration server with unit tests running before each deployment. We create and review PRs before changes are merged and deployed.

Package & Benefits

Competitive salary
Company pension
Company share options
Flexible working
Apple laptop
25 days holiday + Bank Holidays
£250 credit per year on our products (free shaving - yay)
1 paid day per year to volunteer with a charity of your choice
Personal learning and development budget of £750 per year
A great office in London Bridge/ Borough, filled with snacks and drinks
Shower and a Cycle to Work scheme
Regular team lunches and fun nights out

items.content:
(Senior) Frontend/ Backend/ Full Stack Developer (f/m), Berlin // Engel & Völkers Capital

Company: Engel & Völkers Capital

Tags:
  • c
  • .NET
  • AngularJS
  • Angular
  • TypeScript

    • Online investing in real estate – jointly with professional investors. This is what the new crowdinvesting platform by Engel & Völkers Capital offers. We focus on project financing of construction projects, land purchases and existing properties for real estate professionals and property developers. Our vision is to become the leading provider for digital financial solutions in real estate. Become part of a fully independent entrepreneurial start-up within the global Engel & Völkers Group and play a key role in our success story. Show us your skills, ideas and your vision. We are looking to hire (senior) frontend/ backend/ full stack Developers (f/m) in Berlin as soon as possible.

    Your responsibilities

    As front-end developer at Engel & Völkers Capital you will be responsible for creating and maintaining a responsive and beautiful user experience with tech such as Angular 6/AngularJS, Webpack, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, and ASP.NET MVC for our platform. A keen eye for detail and knowledge of what constitutes a good UX are a plus. We rely on new technologies and modern cloud solutions and are open to all modern tech, so if you’re more into React or vue.js we’re interested in hearing from you!

    As for the backend developers, we work with .NET core, C#, ServiceStack, SQL Server and host our products in AWS. Knowledge of docker, CI/CD, micro service architecture, and software design patterns would be great.

    For the full-stack developers, you get to enjoy the best of both worlds.

    Your profile

    You are passionate about developing excellent web applications. You identify necessary tasks and pursue them autonomously in a structured manner until completion. Accuracy and care reflect your course of action. The approach of a deadline – even on short notice – does not make you switch to panic mode. Then we are the perfect match! We are looking for an employee who supports the execution of our projects.

    What we offer

    • Great development opportunities, a flexible work enviroment and room for own ideas and initiatives
    • Start-up atmosphere with short, direct decision-making paths and a family like working enviroment
    • Varied, responsible tasks in a fast-growing fintech company
    • A very experienced, motivated and tech-driven team with a sense for having impact and fun in what they are doing
    • Prime office space with free drinks, fruits and great coffee located directly at Ku\’damm in Berlin
    • Direct access to the global network of Engel & Völkers
    • An attractive benefits package, 28 day holiday plan, flexible and remote working opportunities

    Ready for a new challenge? 

    We are looking forward to your application with your CV and/or online portfolio to be considered for all backend/ frontend/ full stack engineering roles:

    Ujobs@ev-capital.de

    Apply for this position

items.content:
Senior Full Stack Engineer

Company: GoDaddy

About GoDaddy

GoDaddy powers the world's largest cloud platform dedicated to small, independent ventures. With nearly 17 million customers worldwide and over 75 million domain names under management, GoDaddy is the place people come to name their idea, build a professional website, attract customers and manage their work. Our mission is to give our customers the tools, insights and the people to transform their ideas and personal initiative into success. To learn more about the company visit www.GoDaddy.com.

We’re looking for an ambitious software engineer who loves web technologies like JavaScript, React and Node as well as Ruby and Rails. You will be helping to build out the latest features for GoDaddy’s GoCentral site builder suite, leveraging horizontal scaling solutions such as Kubernetes, Cassandra, and Elasticsearch while utilizing the latest browser frameworks like React, Redux and Sagas.

As a full stack engineer, your duties will involve heavy client-side development, complex backend operations, server-side API development and integration efforts. You will work with our global remote team of Developers, Product Owners, UX and UI designers to build and scale a greenfield applications and existing products. This team is responsible for building a world-class offering which provides contact management, email marketing and content creation solutions to small business owners, which includes user-facing features and deep vertical integrations with other products in the suite as well as third party products.

We use React and Redux, MySQL, Redis, Cassandra, Elasticsearch, and Ruby on Rails. Experience with React is required. As part of the team you will be responsible for producing high quality, test driven code to meet and exceed product requirements.

Our team loves working remote. At least once a year we'll all travel to the same location for some face-time, but otherwise you'll find us using Slack, Zoom and email to communicate and get our projects done. We even pair program remotely when needed. Despite being physically apart you'll find us to be a close-knit group who make an effort to get to know each other. We're easy going but hard working; accepting and transparent; and work-life balance is a priority. All that being said, if you feel you want to work at a GoDaddy office, we're totally accommodating to that too.

Responsibilities:

  • Participate in all stages of the software development process
  • Work in an agile Scrum team and participate in all ceremonies
  • Write excellent, performant code and associated tests
  • Work on both front and back-end code and also database schema design
  • Continuously improve application performance, page load times and server response times

Requirements:

  • 2+ years working with React
  • 4+ years developing web applications, using a JavaScript stack with Node or using a framework like Rails
  • Experienced with CSS
  • Passion for building great user interfaces
  • Experience with Cassandra and/or Elasticsearch is a bonus
  • Experience working in an agile environment
  • Familiarity with Scrum ceremonies and experience working on a remote software team
  • Experienced with Git and GitHub
  • Team player, ability to teach as well as learn.

GoDaddy is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of age, race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, medical condition, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status or civil partnership/union status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, childbirth, genetic information, military and veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state or local law. GoDaddy will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with local and federal requirements.

How to apply:
careers.godaddy.com/job/kirkland/full-stack-software-engineer-presence-and-commerce/18045/7727920

items.content:
Front End Software Engineer


Thycotic


Thycotic, a global leader in IT security, is the fastest growing provider of Privileged Account Management solutions that protect an organization’s most valuable assets from cyber-attacks and insider threats. Our mission is to make self-sufficient security champions, by making security tools people love to use that make privilege management achievable for everyone. We help organizations protect what matters most, by limiting privileged account risk, implementing least privilege policies, controlling applications, and demonstrating compliance.

 The results show:


* We have over 10,000 customers worldwide ranging from small IT shops to Fortune 5 companies and are adding new customers each day!

* We are Rated #1 in customer satisfaction, achieving a 96% renewal rate!

* We are among Inc. 5000 Fastest Growing Companies six years in a row!

* We have a STELLAR Glassdoor rating among employees!






POSITION SUMMARY

Working as a Software Engineer at Thycotic means being a part of a highly capable, collaborative and agile development team. Thycotic is creating awesome software that’s used by thousands of IT professionals all over the globe.

Front End engineers work on the full-stack, but are experts when it comes to JavaScript, CSS, and modern JavaScript frameworks, like Angular, jQuery, or Aurelia.  We are passionate about building the most intuitive user experience and will code anything from C# to CSS just to ensure that the user comes first.

This is a remote/telecommute position based out of your home office. Reports to the UI/UX Team Lead. 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


* Develop code for the complete development stack with emphasis on the front end

* Work with designers and product management to define and improve user experience

* Develop cohesive user interface components and flows

* Define and advocate user interface framework standards

* Provide user interface modules and guidance for the rest of the development team






REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS


* Minimum of 5 years of experience in C#, ASP.NET, HTML, MS SQL Server, JavaScript, JQuery, CSS, and related technologies

* Strong design skills and full software development lifecycle experience required

* Experience with Angular 2+ and TypeScript

* Strong understanding of JavaScript, Object Oriented principles, the .NET Framework, ASP.NET, relational databases, and web application development

* Passionate about writing quality code and constantly honing your development skills

* Ability to quickly read and understand both new and existing code

* See the “big picture,” coming up with great new ideas, but also executing those ideas and writing the code to make it happen

* Enjoy working in a highly collaborative, flat environment

* Experience with large codebases and unit testing – mock frameworks, web testing, database testing, etc.

* Desire to develop using Test Driven Development

* Desire to develop using pair programming








Thycotic is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, ancestry, national origin, color, religion, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status.

Upon conditional offer of employment, candidates are required to complete a criminal background check and drug screen per Thycotic employment policy. In addition, all publicly posted social media sites may be reviewed.



V2.9.2018

See more jobs at Thycotic

items.content:
Front-end Engineer - Flattr

Company: Flattr
Location: Malmö, Sweden, Remote Allowed
Job type: Full-time
Skills:
  • Frontend
  • Javascript
  • opensource
  • sweden
  • vue
  • VueJS

    • Company description

    Flattr is a contribution system that allows users to effortlessly fund the content creators they love. Unlike other micropayment platforms, creators signed up with Flattr are not supposed to do anything extra - no tiers, no extra work, no hassle. A Flattr subscription can be used to support any number of creators and not just one. On the contributor side, users simply select a 30-day subscription and let Flattr’s smart system take care of the rest. At the end of the 30 days, their subscription is divided between the creators they have enjoyed the most.

    The Swedish saying, "Många bäckar små blir en stor å" (many small streams form a large river), outlines the philosophy of Flattr — small contributions from many can make a meaningful difference! So join us - with your help and your creativity, we can make the internet even better.

    Job description

    Get to know Flattr

    Flattr is a contribution system that allows users to effortlessly fund the content creators they love. Unlike other micropayment platforms, creators signed up with Flattr are not supposed to do anything extra - no tiers, no extra work, no hassle. A Flattr subscription can be used to support any number of creators and not just one. On the contributor side, users simply select a 30-day subscription and let Flattr’s smart system take care of the rest. At the end of the 30 days, their subscription is divided between the creators they have enjoyed the most.

    The Swedish saying, "Många bäckar små blir en stor å" (many small streams form a large river), outlines the philosophy of Flattr — small contributions from many can make a meaningful difference! So join us - with your help and your creativity, we can make the internet even better.

    Get to know eyeo

    Flattr is owned by eyeo. We create open source software that puts users in control over their online browsing experience. Our desktop and mobile products, such as Adblock Plus, Adblock Browser and Flattr, help sustain and grow a fair, open web, because they give users control while providing user-friendly monetization. Our most popular product, Adblock Plus (ABP), is currently used on over 100 million devices.

    After your morning coffee, you’ll be expected to...

    • Help with any front end requirements Flattr needs
    • Come up with ideas and implement ways of improving the user experience on flattr.com
    • Use your Vue.js skills and optimize the current codebase (we have legacy code that needs love)
    • Work with other team members on code reviews

    What you should already know...

    • Experience with Vue.js
    • Exceptional JS, CSS, and HTML skills
    • Familiarity with webpack and yarn
    • Fluent in both verbal and written English

    About the team

    You’ll be part of a small but engaged team where we prioritise team chemistry and having fun. Since work is undoubtedly part of your life, we want it to be interesting and fun. We work in a startup environment where things move fast and change quite a bit, so be prepared to roll up your sleeves and operate outside of the traditional role definitions.

    Apply now!

items.content:
Full Stack Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: AI Research, Cybersecurity, Security Software
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Cigent Technology, Inc. | Fort Myers, FL

Remote details

Office Location: Fort Myers, FL. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

reactjs
javascript
mysql
python
angular

Job description

Cigent Technology, Inc., a Silicon Valley funded startup based in Downtown Fort Myers, Florida is looking for talented individuals to join it’s top tier team to develop the next generation of cybersecurity products. Cigent’s patented software technologies are the last line in data defense, providing deep level detection and response to data threat events.

Cigent offers qualified individuals an extremely competitive compensation package including:

  • Competitive salaries
  • Vested employee stock options
  • Competitive health benefits
  • Flexible work arrangements (remote work is possible for the right candidates)
  • Work, Live and Play in the Southwest Florida Paradise!

We are looking for tenacious individuals with a passion for digging deep, solving meaningful and complex problems to join our team and make a difference.

If you are looking for a fast paced and interesting endeavor that will challenge your skillset and utilizes the latest in software, hardware and cybersecurity technologies, you belong on our team and we want to talk to you!

Cigent Technology, Inc., is looking for a Full Stack Developer.

Individuals applying for this position should posses following skills or the ability to quickly obtain the following skills:

  • 3+ years designing RESTful API’s
  • 3+ years of experience with Javascript
  • 3+ years of experience with Python
  • 3+ years of experience with SQL (MySql/MariaDB) and NoSQL (MongoDB)
  • Practical experience with common web frameworks/libraries (Angular, React, etc.)
  • Practical experience with HTML and CSS
  • Practical experience with PHP
  • Understanding of Web Servers (nginx preferable)
  • Understanding of big data analytics and storage systems (elasticsearch, kibana)
  • Understanding of cloud principals and providers (Google, AWS, etc)

We are looking for an individual with a desire and ability to work with a face paced, technologically advanced team to design and build the backend infrastructure required to bridge the gap between the UI/UX team and the product development team.

Responsibilities include working with the team to enhance our cybersecurity product offerings, rapid prototyping to full production versions of new and innovative API solutions and research/development of the best API technologies to deliver our solutions to market.

Position reports to the VP of Engineering.

Education

A Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related technical field is desired. The equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.

Apply now

About Cigent Technology, Inc.

Our engineers work on solutions that range from embedded firmware all the way up to cloud-based AI/ML solutions and everything in between.  We are an intense team of firmware engineers, data scientists, embedded developers, UI/UX developers, and cybersecurity experts.

Benefits

  • Interesting challenges
  • Diverse tech stack
  • Passionate development team
  • Great location
  • Remote work available
  • Competitive salaries
  • Free healthcare (for employee only)

* Understanding of Web Servers (nginx preferable)

* Understanding of big data analytics and storage systems (elasticsearch, kibana)

* Understanding of cloud principals and providers (Google, AWS, etc)




We are looking for an individual with a desire and ability to work with a face paced, technologically advanced team to design and build the backend infrastructure required to bridge the gap between the UI/UX team and the product development team.

Responsibilities include working with the team to enhance our cybersecurity product offerings, rapid prototyping to full production versions of new and innovative API solutions and research/development of the best API technologies to deliver our solutions to market.

Position reports to the VP of Engineering.

Education

A Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related technical field is desired. The equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.

items.content:
Lead BPM Developer: Web/Mobile Low Code Configurable Platform

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Business Process Optmization, Enterprise Software, Mobile Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Primotus Division of CargoTel | No office location

Technologies

bpm
java
elasticsearch
rule-engine

Job description

Overview

Primotus is developing a unique Enterprise scale, no/low code configurable mobile workflow platform, which allows Primotus or users to design an entire systems - including drag-and-drop database, forms, entitlements, processes, mobile applications, business decisions, messages, reports, and maps - with little to no developer support. The platform is flexible enough to be deployed for a myriad of business verticals.

We’re looking for a Lead Business Process Management (BPM) and rules developer, who can extend our base open-source platform with advanced BPM functions and add Case Management (CMMN). Platform is built using Scala, Java, Kafka, Postgres, ElasticSearch, WebSockets, and Angular.  And uses new DMN standard for Business Rules/Decision Management.

Position is open to North/South American and European candidates who meet the requirements outlined below and can work mostly during Eastern timezone.  Sorry, no applicants needing H1. 

You’d be: Spearheading everything BPM, CMMN, and DMN using open-source tools and integrating such tools with core Primotus system, consisting of already developed Form Builder, Entitlement Manager, Mobile Application Builder, Reporting Engine, Message Builders, and DMN platform. Some of the specifics include:

  • Extending BPM functions including complex multi-instance functionality and other advanced features
  • Migrating existing BPM modeler to new platform. 
  • Implementing CMMN (Case Management and integrating with BPM and DMN to allow for multi-platform deployments.  
  • Juggling multiple stories and implementations in an Agile work environment
  • Improving platform testability and augmenting testing tools
  • Enhancing documentation
  • Pairing with frontend, backend, and analysts
  • Available to work mostly on Eastern Time (ET)

You’re expected to have:

  • 5+ years BPM and rules experience; ideally with some of the open-source platforms (Activiti, Camunda, JBPM), etc). 
  • 2+ years with Rules Engines
  • 5+ years experience in Java ecosystem
  • 3+ years with SQL and NoSQL databases, particularly Elastic Search or SOLR. 
  • 3+ years with Restful (and/or GraphQL) 
  • Extensive experience with Java-based testing tools 
  • Knowledge of scrum or agile methods
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills (English)
  • Ability to work in a paired-development environment
  • Bachelor's degree from University or College
  • Self starter having worked remotely
  • Committed to meeting deadlines

Nice to have:

  • DMN 1.1 experience 
  • Exposure with CMMN (Case Management)  
  • Experience with Scala or functional programming languages
  • Exposure to cloud computing platforms, particularly AWS
  • Experience with third-party integrations
  • Experience with some of the tools highlighted above along with Agile development using JIRA and Git

Our Stack : Includes many of the most-desired technologies, including:

Frontend:

  • Angular 1x/6, TypeScript, Ionic Mobile, React, Redux
  • CSS3, Bootstrap
  • PWA (Progressive Web Apps)

Backend:

  • BPMN (Java), DMN (Java)
  • Scala/Akka, Play Framework, Slick
  • Web Sockets
  • Kafka (event-based processing)
  • Postgres, ElasticSearch
  • Restful API

DevOps:

  • Jenkins
  • Webpack
  • GIT, GitHub
  • AWS

Our development team:

  • Is small and growing with 10 members, so you'll have a significant impact
  • Team is multi-cultural from USA, Mexico, South Amercia and Europe 
  • Is divided into frontend and backend teams
  • Separates code into distinct modules and services
  • Uses JSON API for backend/frontend integration
  • Applies Agile programming and paired development methodology in 3-week sprints
  • Works in a virtual environment

If you think you’re a good fit and are interested in building something highly configurable and really innovative, please shoot us an email.

Apply now

About Primotus Division of CargoTel

Primotus is a well-funded and stable development-stage company. Developers work remotely but we embrace paired development and sharing knowledge.  We encourage developer creativity, provide a high-degree of flexibility, and don't put developers on the clock.  

Please see our web site http://primotus.com for more information. 

Competitive salary and full benefits including medical, dental, 401k (including Primotus contributions), and flex time.

Benefits

  • vacation of holidays
  • medical and dental
  • flexible working hours
  • work at home

items.content:
Full Stack Developer Wordpress


Sanborn


The No-Bullshit-iest Way We Can Describe This Job In The Least Amount Of Words In A Run-On Sentence:

We build a lot of different kinds of stuff for a lot of different kinds of folks (https://sanbornagency.com/work/) at a shop that is big enough to bite off important, meaningful work and small enough to have fun doing it and we’re looking for an engineer who is equally at ease talking to clients, designers, producers, and developers about things like scope, resource allocation, solutions to engineering problems, creative ideas for how to build things, ways to articulate technical complexity to normal business humans...and occasionally...cut some code.

Here’s What We Think You Probably Need to Be Successful At This Job:


* Experience in architecting and building bespoke custom WordPress themes using Advanced Custom Fields, Gravity Forms, Yoast with custom integrations to third party systems.

* You do so much Wordpress that you have strongly-held opinions about its future, its architecture, and the "right ways" to build with WP.  We keep our stack lean and don't go plugin-heavy.

* You have strong opinions on, and respect for, the design process.

* We mostly do a lot of HTML, CSS, PHP, MySQL and JavaScript -- we keep it lean and get the job done.

* Have agency experience, working across multiple projects and clients.

* Are comfortable delivering projects using current web standards based on project specifications, collaborating with project management and design colleagues

* Experienced in code reviews to adhere to best practices and internal standards, providing feedback and following up on remediation

* You have an ear to the ground for new tech, whether it comes from hacker news or a programming subreddit, and a desire to dive in and try it out.

* Experience in client and server-side debugging, performance profiling and optimization techniques with an uncanny intuition for finding the cause and solution

* Experience with integration of analytics, a/b testing, and advertising platforms using Google Tag Manager

* Comfortable working with small projects (1 dev) and medium projects (2-3 devs)

* Comfortable in architecting and implementation of APIs in PHP/Laravel, NodeJS/Express and other similar stacks.

* Attention to detail and a seamless user experience.  This means making the product look like the design and working with your team to make it smooth and perfect.

* jQuery is "nice to have" but NOT necessary in your arsenal.  You respect the finer points of the browser rendering pipeline and know when to 3D transform (and when NOT to).  Oh, and calls to GetComputedStyle make you shudder, especially when jQuery is obfuscating them.

* You know your way around configuring a local development environment with help from the Interwebz, of course.

* You have a willingness to express yourself through animated gifs and obscure movie quotes from the youtubes.

* You work well at the 11th hour, but even better at the first and second so we can be out by happy hour.

* You're down with remote work. We've got offices in NY / LA but we encourage working from home, from coffee shops, from wherever you feel most comfortable. We've got tools in place to keep communication going online and we love that we can all be in different parts of the country and work together.

* We constantly improve only because we don't bullshit each other or our clients. We don't hide; we don't say what we think others want to hear. We do our work with respect, and we value truth, transparency, and honesty above all else.




Nice to Have:


* You have real-world experience with Nuxt, React, or Vue.

* You know what DevOps is but aren't necessarily a zealot for any one process, technology, or denomination.

* Experienced in concepting high-level architectures and codifying them in visual and written documentation

* Experienced with CI / CD build automation tools such as DeployBot, Jenkins, and Travis CI

* Jumping in to assist developers who are in need of aid in implementation and/or troubleshooting of backend or frontend development goals

* Aiding and/or leading bug triage in coordination with Project Manager throughout project and during QA




To Apply: 

If you are interested, please apply with a resume and introduction. 

Please feel free to skip the formality of a cover letter and write to me as a human being.  If you need to use a four letter word to effectively express a previous engagement or an appropriately inappropriate metaphor to describe your ideal work environment, I’ll take that over what you would think I typically “need to hear” in a job application. Be yourself. The truth is the easiest thing to remember and I don’t have time to weed through cover-letter-speak to find out who you really are and what you want in life. Just tell me.

See more jobs at Sanborn
