Level 12 | Full Stack Web Developer - Python, React, SQL | Louisville, KY | REMOTE, SALARY:$75K-125K, https://www.level12.io/careers/

We have a openings for mid and senior level positions. Please see our website for a very detailed job description written by a developer for developers. No plain, repetitive, HR riddled job description here, we want you to know what you are really getting into:

https://www.level12.io/careers/

- If you apply as instructed, we will give you a yay or nay response. No black holes here!

- We have a commitment to transparency and offer a “no surprises experience” throughout the interview and hiring process.

- We practice and preach sound development practices. You are likely to learn and grow as a developer while working here.

- You will have the option of working from home or our office, whatever suits you best. Let’s make the most of our time and minimize commuting when not necessary.

- We emphasize work/life balance and adopt policies that make sure our people don’t get burnt out. For instance, our PTO/Vacation policies are designed so that you actually use them.

- You are committed to automated testing of all the software you write (our apps typically have 92%+ test coverage).

- You recognize that there is a lot of idealism in the software development community and are not disenchanted with the the day-to-day realities of programming.

Senior Front End Developer (React, JavaScript)

Senior Front End Developer with experience of creating clean code with React and JavaScript, to work for an exciting, dynamic and fast growing technology business. Due to growth within the business and a massive pipeline of projects; they are looking to bring on a number of Software engineers, with experience of working with React and JavaScript to be working on API technology projects. The Senior Front End Developer will be joining the team based in London or opportunities to work remotely.

The nature of the role will be to work within a talented software development team who are based in London and remotely also; working on API technology platforms and cloud based systems. The software engineer will be building scalable technology products the Front End and using Javascript technologies such as React, Redux to build Serverless Single Page Applications (SPA).

The ideal software engineer will have the following experience:

  • 4 Years + Front End Software Development Experience
  • Experience with JavaScript and JavaScript Libraries such as React or Redux
  • Building Serverless Single Page applications
  • Working with remote development teams

This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of a fast growing technology business that are going through a really exciting period of growth. They offer a fantastic working culture with great flexibility and autonomy. Long term they believe to provide the most effective solutions, their development team will be a language agnostic team.

Capita IT Resourcing is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=16, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=59}
items.content:
CareStack | Senior/Principal Frontend Developer | Full-Time | ONSITE preferred, REMOTE possible | Cambridge, MA | https://carestack.com

CareStack is a dental practice management SaaS. We're helping dentists capture hundreds of thousands of dollars more than with legacy tools through schedule optimization and improved claims management--and no, that's not just hype, it's real. We've just landed a $16M Series A, led by Accel, Eight Roads Ventures and F-Prime Capital Partners, and we're expanding our development team from India to the United States. The company has product-market fit and our onboarding pipeline has filled up nicely. Now it's up to the engineering team to really turn the product into something special--something that our customers are delighted to pay us for. Having that kind of product-market fit so early and reducing a lot of it to technical problems is a different situation than a lot of startups at this stage, but it makes things a whole lot more fun.

Right now, we're in need of product-minded senior and principal-level frontend developers who have a track record of making sustainable long-term decisions. Our stack is .NET (though .NET experience isn't required) and Angular 1/TypeScript; the future of the usual frontend may be a modern version of Angular or a move to React, and it's largely up to the leaders of our frontend team to decide. (Our mobile work will probably be React Native.) In addition to technical and architectural competence, a big part of the role is helping to socialize good practices to our existing developer base as well as to forge ahead with the usual: new features, performance and stability improvements, and the like.

As for me, I'm the Director of Infrastructure here--I was impressed enough by the company and the team to wind down my consulting business to come here. For those of you who know me from HN, you know that I'm big on generosity, kindness, and competence, and I'm happy to say that this team is better at all of the above than any team I've ever worked with in the past. We all teach; we all learn. It is a pleasure to come into work everyday.

Our team is primarily Boston-centric--I was the first engineer hired into this office, we're up to 7 local now. We do offer relocation for the right candidates and we will consider remote hires.

eropple@carestack.com - put "[HN WHO'S HIRING]" in the subject line.

items.content:
Senior React Engineer

Company: Superformula

Job description

We are seeking a full-time Senior React engineer with experience building high-traffic and production-ready web applications. This is a high visibility product team where you will get a chance to make a positive impact on customer experience in the hospitality industry, designing and building the next generation client architecture that currently serves 80MM monthly visitors. 

Job can be remote (USA - West Coast) or in Portland, Seattle, or LA

  • Be responsible for maintaining and expanding the feature set and component library
  • Own individual modules and act as the technical SME for them 
  • Work alongside an incredible team of designers, strategists and engineers and solve difficult problems 
  • Learn from skilled veterans on building software and get guidance on your career growth 
  • Ability to work early hours to communicate to our developments teams in LA and Poland 
  • Move and adapt to change at a rapid pace 
  • Interface with creative, business, and engineers alike 
  • Quick learner with passion to learn and adapt to new technologies
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills and being a team player 
  • Attention to details and striving for perfection
  • Honest, mature, committed and ensure a high level of communication

Basic Requirements

  • 5+ years of professional experience as a senior software developer or senior web developer
  • 5+ years designing, developing, and scaling modern web applications
  • 5+ years experience with JavaScript, HTML5, CSS/SASS, and modern web technologies NodeJS, React, Mobx, Webpack

Technical Requirements

  • Strong ability for reasoning with complex async code, deep understanding of the JS event loop
  • Expertise in using Developer Tools for debugging, live editing, perf evaluation, JS profiling, etc
  • Solid understanding of both object oriented and functional programming paradigms
  • Understanding of code chunking strategies 
  • Writing unit tests with tools such as Mocha/Chai, Jasmine, or Jest as well as UI component unit tests using Enzyme, or similar
  • Well-versed in distributed version control systems and patterns such as Git, GitHub, Git Flow
  • Proven record of creating commercial quality software, 
  • Proven record of being team player and performing peer code reviews
  • Ability to ensure technical feasibility of UI/UX design


Bonus Points

  • Familiarity / experience with Next.js, GraphQL/Apollo, Redux, Relay Modern, Storybook.js,
  • Familiarity with Adobe Experience Manager / Cloud
  • Familiarity / experience of headless web architectures (CMS)
  • Experience building Progressive Web Apps
How to apply:
careers.superformula.com/o/sr-react-engineer

items.title: Salesforce Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=5, c=2, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
Salesforce Developer at Live Nation Entertainment

Remote

Job Type: Full Time

Req #: JR-13672

Location: Ideal candidate would be located in the Los Angeles or Houston area, but we are open to remote and/or telecommute arrangements that are US based. Open to Remote based. Can work from any state in US.

Job Category: Information Technology

Why You Should Work With Us:

Live Nation has built its concerts management system on the Salesforce platform. This system is a rebuild / modernization of a homegrown system that had been refined over 10+ years and is the central nervous system of the North American concerts business. As part of being this central nervous system, this system connects to the other financial, analytics, and operational systems used in the concerts business.

Over the next few years, Live Nation is looking to (i) optimize this system, (ii) build additional features into this system, (iii) expand this system geographically (which will require refinements to address the intricacies of Live Nation’s international business), and (iv) build related applications on the Salesforce platform (e.g., festivals management). This role will be an integral part of these development efforts.

In addition, this role will be part of the team responsible for concerts information systems, financial systems, analytics, integrations, etc. As such, as Live Nation continues to expand the role of technology and data in its concerts business, there will be additional opportunities to contribute beyond the ongoing development of the core application built on the Salesforce platform.

Job Description:

The successful candidate for this position will work on Salesforce Solution Design, Prototypes, and Development and Unit testing for various Salesforce initiatives. The person in this role will work with Business Analysts/Salesforce Administrators/Business Leaders in tailoring solutions that meet business needs through the use of an agile/iterative development process. This role will implement solutions through a combination of Salesforce configuration, and custom development on the Force.com platform. This role will be also working with Salesforce support, Security, Network and Infrastructure teams to resolve critical issues.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Translate functional requirements into technical design and develop robust solutions for each planned release
  • Responsible for the detailed design of technical solutions, Proof-of-Concepts (POC), prototyping and documentation of the technical design
  • Produce elegant code to meet design specifications using Apex, VisualForce and other technologies (eg XML, HTTP/HTTPS, Javascript, JSON)
  • Contribute to overall code quality by performing design and code reviews for fellow developers
  • Perform basic and extended unit tests for releases (internal and salesforce releases)
  • Perform release migration tasks (change sets, config, data load etc.) and environment setup/management using Github and Jenkins
  • Provide level 3 production support (involving appropriate functional teams when needed)
  • Help with triaging and fixing defects for the planned releases and production
  • Perform advanced salesforce administration (Sandboxes management, Salesforce release and patches, User management, workflow and approval rules, Permission Sets etc.)
  • Continuous improvement of development processes for the Force.com platform using industry-standard and emerging practices like Agile, Continuous Integration, etc.
  • Build and maintain great working relationship with peer teams

PREFERRED EDUCATION:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems; or 4 years equivalent experience

REQUIRED MINIMUM EXPERIENCE:

  • Minimum 2 years of hands-on development experience with Salesforce.com developer toolkit (Apex Classes, Controllers and Triggers, Visualforce, Force.com IDE, Migration Tool, Web Services etc.)
  • 2-4 years of hands-on Object-Oriented programming experience using Java, C# or similar languages
  • Proficiency with version control system (like Git, Subversion or similar)
  • Proficiency with test driven development (TDD) and test automation tools for web-based applications (Selenium, Windmill, etc.)
  • Experience setting up and utilizing Continuous Integration (CI) severs (like Hudson, Jenkins or similar) for build and process automation
  • Experience integrating salesforce with 3rd party systems using web services, ETL Tools, and app exchange apps
  • Knowledge of Force.com development best practices and design patterns
  • Experience integrating SalesForce with multiple data sources
  • Familiarity with web application development technologies like JavaScript, AJAX, JSON, HTML5 and CSS preferred

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS:

  • SFDC Certified Developer and/or Advance Developer is strongly preferred
  • SFDC Administrator/Advanced Administrator certification is a plus
  • Experience with Agile development processes is preferred

ABILITIES AND SKILLS:

  • Demonstrated ability to deliver results on time and produce high quality deliverables (accuracy and thoroughness)
  • Demonstrated expertise on programming best practices, design patterns and design trade-offs on internet and cloud based platforms
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to organize and lead technical meetings to achieve a given set objectives
  • Ability to build and maintain effective working relationships with other team members (immediate team as well as cross-functional teams)
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple concurrent projects
  • Self-motivated and ability to apply good judgment and decision-making skills
  • Strong professionalism and interpersonal skills

KEY INTERNAL/EXTERNAL CONTACTS:

  • Business Unit Representatives
  • SFDC Power Users
  • IT Cloud Services Team
  • SAP Operations Team
  • Business Intelligence Operations Team
  • Third Party – SFDC, App Vendors, Contract Resources
Apply for job

items.content:
Frontend Developer

Full-time
Los Angeles, CA or Brooklyn, NY (preferred)
Remote job
Mid-sized business
Posted Today – Accepting applications
NationBuilder is seeking a visually oriented front-end developer with a strong command of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. In collaboration with the design team, you will build, maintain, and improve our online website properties and demonstrate to the world what is possible with NationBuilder.

This is an excellent position for someone who thrives working in creative environments. You should have experience hacking existing frameworks, and have no problem building your own.

NationBuilder offers everyone the technology and community infrastructure to lead people to greatness. Our customers range from political candidates and nonprofits to corporations - anyone building a community of people to make something happen in the world.

NationBuilder websites use HTML (extended by Liquid), CSS (extended by SASS) and JavaScript. To learn more about NationBuilder, read our mission, beliefs and values.

The design team is based in Brooklyn, New York, but working remotely is a possibility if required.

We are looking for someone who…
  • Has a strong command of HTML/CSS/SCSS/JavaScript, cross-browser development, and writes semantic, scalable code.
  • Has experience building polished responsive websites and a portfolio to prove it.
  • Is strongly visually oriented and precise in code, communication, and documentation.
  • Is a pragmatic problem solver, knowing how to find the middle ground between “perfect, but takes forever to code” and “fixes it now, but nobody will ever be able to understand what I did.”
  • Is a clear and concise communicator with excellent collaboration skills.
  • Is humble, passionate about personal growth, and would rather be “better” than “right.”
  • Proactively seeks out feedback and welcomes it as an opportunity to grow.
  • Has a strong work ethic, a quick learner and is willing to work with a fast-paced team.

  • Has a strong work ethic, a quick learner and is willing to work with a fast-paced team.

items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

LOCATION:
Swindon, UK
(Partial remote)

Anywhere in
Swindon

EXPERIENCE: intermediate

COMPANY: Q CHI LIMITED; 1-10 employees; 0-25% remote;

SKILLS:
• AJAX
• JavaScript
• NoSQL
• JSON
• ReactJS

This dynamic and fast-growing software company requires an experienced and successful Full-stack Software Developer to help innovate, develop and maintain their cloud-software platform. This is a permanent role, based in Swindon, United Kingdom.

You will play a key part in a small team responsible for developing high-quality solutions against Jira Stories according to established standards, using an Agile Scrum methodology. You will be able to communicate effectively with technical colleagues, and stakeholders. You will be expected to take a proactive role in identifying and implementing software improvements. This role presents an opportunity to work towards a senior position.

Main Responsibilities:
- Develop front-end UX code using: JavaScript, React, AJAX, HTML5, CSS3
- Integrate front-end UX with back-end NoSQL data stores and business logic
- Write and perform Unit Tests using Automated Tests Frameworks
- Maintain clear documentation
- Collaborate in Agile Scrum planning, sprints and retrospectives
- Take ownership in developing and testing against user stories towards acceptance
- Help to foster a culture of continuous improvement and quality

Essential Skills:
- Strong Javascript skills:
o JS eco-system: Webpack, Babel, ES6, NPM, Yarn
o JS frameworks: React (Redux, React-Router), Angular, or Vue
- HTML5, CSS3, BootStrap
- Good understanding of relational and non-relational (NoSQL) databases
- Good understanding of REST API design principles
- Experience of working with Agile Scrum Sprints

Additional / Desirable Skills:
- React Javascript Framework
- Automated Tests framework
- IBM Eclipse / Domino Designer
- Java
- Experience in developing RESTful Web Services
- ASP.NET / Core / C# / Visual Studio
- MVC / MVVM experience with Angular
- NoSQL databases (MongoDB, couchDB, couchBase, Domino)
- SASS / LESS
- Jira / Confluence
- Photoshop / Illustrator for design, icons, images, mockups

Professional and Other:
- Minimum 3 years proven commercial experience in software development
- Track record of delivering successful technical solutions
- Ability to work both independently and collaboratively as part of a small team
- Reliable unit, integration and regression testing skills
- Organised, reliable and thorough; a strong attention to detail
- Graduate (Computer Science or Software Engineering preferred)
- Clear English verbal and written communication skills

Benefits:
- Salary range from £30K to £40K - offer dependent upon skills and experience
- Additional performance and project-related bonuses
- Company pension scheme
- Salary-sacrifice options (eg. company health and dental)
- 25 days holiday + Bank holidays

Terms:
- This is a permanent, full-time position, based in Swindon, United Kingdom

items.content:
Senior Frontend Developer | Senior Software Engineer (f/m)

We digitize the oldest industry in the world - agriculture - to support farmers in making better use of their limited resources and improve their management & organization.
At our AgTech startups & ventures of Yara International you will enjoy the culture & pace of a startup with serious backing & support of a leading provider of crop nutrition solutions to 20 million farmers across 160 countries.

In an effort to scale and internationalize our application, we’d love to extend our current team: Working closely with our colleagues in Backend, Mobile as well as PM we enjoy the contentment that comes out of knowing that we build something meaningful, something that makes life of farmers easier.

We care about crafting a quality product for the long-term and value continuous learning and teaching over many years of experience. We follow a data-driven process and iterate quickly whenever necessary.  

Join us in our mission to responsibly feed the world and protect the planet by building the most recommended software in agriculture worldwide.

Reasons to join trecker.com

  • Challenging tasks that enable you to grow & excel: next year we want to include data from drones and other sensors
  • Cutting-edge tech stack, great test coverage, high code quality & multiple deploys per day
  • Meaningful product: The chance to revolutionize an entire sector & change the lives of millions
  • No-Worries package: Permanent contract + above average compensation package e.g. company pension, moving aid
  • Transparency: Know what's going on! In a weekly all-hands meeting we share business information openly
  • Work-Life Balance: Flexible working hours, working from home/remote option + 31 days of vacation 
  • Personal development: Large development opportunities e.g. Tech talks, conferences, team meetups, inhouse workshops etc.
  • Great team: Join a passionate team & fun company events such as a trip to the Baltic Sea

 Your playground

  • As frontend engineer you develop a sense of ownership for frontend code
  • You write clean, testable, scalable and maintainable code that complies with web standards and best practices
  • You improve development knowledge/skills of the team by pair programming, teaching best practices and by doing code reviews
  • You share your experience in building large-scale single-page applications and work on RESTful APIs and websockets
  • You support the team with your knowledge in designing frontend architecture and build processes 
  • Plan, architect and integrate frontend functionality in collaboration with backend, frontend, mobile developers and PM

You fit perfectly if you

  • Have BS/MS in Computer Science or a related technical field preferred
  • Have 3+ years of JavaScript experience, including concepts like asynchronous programming, closures, types, and ES6. Experience with React is a bonus
  • Have 3+ years of HTML/CSS experience, including concepts like layout, specificity, cross browser compatibility, and accessibility
  • Familiarity with native mobile development (iOS/Android) and/or web backend development (RoR, Golang) would be a bonus
  • Have prior experience with source control tools – Git, Github
  • Are comfortable with agile development methodologies such as SCRUM or KANBAN
  • Speak code and English fluently – German knowledge is a plus

Our current tech stack: Rails 5x, Go, React, iOS Swift 4, Android, Postgres, ElasticSearch, REST api, Microservices, Realtime web,  AWS, Grape, Webpack, Swagger, Jira

We are looking forward to speaking with you!

Apply now

items.content:
A large and highly reputable digital agency are now recruiting for a skilled Remote Front-End Developer to join their continuously expanding development team. This is an opportunity for you as a skilled Front-End Developer to work on large scale E-Commerce builds for some of the biggest companies in the UK, using the latest technology the market has to offer. You will also be provided with ongoing training and a leading progression plan from day one.

Your skills & experience;

  • Minimum 2 years' experience working in a similar Front-End Developer role
  • Excellent knowledge of HTML & CSS
  • Strong experience working with modern Javascript libraries, any of; AngularJS, ReactJS, VueJS etc
  • Ability to converse directly with clients- previous Freelancing experience would be desired
  • E-Commerce experience would also be highly desirable
  • Comfortable working completely remote from home
  • Ability to manage your own time effectively

In return, you as the successful Front-End Developer can expect to receive a basic salary of up to £28,000 as well as various perks that come as part of your package.

If you feel that you match the above criteria and would like to be considered for the role, please send your CV to Adam Dolan at Capita IT Resourcing now by clicking the apply button below.

  • * PLEASE NOTE: Interviews will take place immediately for suitable Front-End Developer candidates* * *

Capita IT Resourcing is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

items.content:
UI Developer

Developer
Anywhere
Company: Mozilla
Full Time

Overview

The Internet you know and love is at risk. A range of political and commercial forces threaten our chances to keep the Internet a , open and accessible to all.

global public resource

At Mozilla Foundation, we’re building a movement to protect and advance the Internet. From fellowships to festivals, campaigns to research, Mozilla impacts the world through diverse initiatives. As an engineer, you will help drive this mission through several platforms:

  • Mozilla Foundation
  • Mozilla Pulse
  • Internet Health Report
  • Privacy Not Included

    : Are you a front-end engineer who cares deeply about user experience and design? In this role, you will advance our web platforms to increase Mozilla’s impact. We prefer someone located near other staff in New York NY, Vancouver BC, or Toronto ON, but will consider remote work for an outstanding individual.

    The Role

    Mozilla Foundation is committed to diversity and especially encourage members of underrepresented communities to apply.

    Please note this is a one year fixed-term opportunity.

    :

    You have
    • Talent for crafting elegant web interfaces
    • An eye for visual design, translated carefully in code
    • Skill with responsive web principles and methods
    • Ability to build high-quality interactive elements using CSS and Javascript
    • Eagerness to learn, expand your skills, and try new tools
    • Expertise with modern JavaScript, CSS and HTML
    • Comfortable working with version control (Mentoring available. Experience with Git and Github is helpful)
    • Eager to expand your technical skill set – our primary stack is Django (Wagtail), with a sprinkling of React, and Sass
    • Passion for collaborative work – excellent interpersonal and communication skills
    • 1-3 years of experience

      • :

      What you will do
      • Implement responsive designs in CSS/HTML/Javascript
      • Make delightful interactive features on web properties
      • Collaborate with visual designers and engineers to ensure a seamless user experience from design to implementation
      • Conduct peer code reviews and discuss feedback with designers and program staff
      • Work with data insights and Analytics integration
      • Advocate for users and top-notch web practices
      • Travel periodically for face-to-face teamwork

        • :

        Experience Pluses (not required)
        • Active on GitHub
        • Gather requirements and draft wireframes
        • Work on open source projects
        • Develop accessible web sites
        • Write automated tests for client side code
        • Work with a remote team

          • : Excellent benefits, generous vacation time, paid trips to multiple events, and work alongside an incredible team.

          Job perks

           Send a cover letter, resume, and links to your work (please list your primary contributions). If you are deeply passionate about building great user experiences, please don’t hesitate to apply even if your experience and skills doesn’t perfectly match our ideal credentials. We all love to expand our skills through our work.

          Interested?

          Will you help us make the Internet a better place for everyone?

          We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.



          To apply for this job please visit the URL below.

          Please reference Jobspresso in your job application, so that remote companies know where their best candidates are coming from

          https://boards.greenhouse.io/mozilla/jobs/1389047 →
